so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stato lustri die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 781" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 781</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status sacrificii dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum tempus, statā vice, etc.: lunae defectio statis temporibus fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 37 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stato tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stata tempora (partus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo in illā plagā mundus statas vices temporum mutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:19:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 19, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:23" default="NO">5, 1, 23</bibl>; so, feriae, etc.: feriae statae appellabantur quod certo statutoque die observarentur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=69" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 69</bibl> Lind.: <cit><quote lang="la">stata quinquennia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stata sacra or sacrificia: stata sacrificia sunt quae certis diebus fieri debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=264" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 264</bibl></cit> Lind.: <cit><quote lang="la">proficiscuntur Aeniam ad statum sacrificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 46, 2</bibl>; 39, 13, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solemne et statum sacrificium (al. statutum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stata sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:528" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 528</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:666" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 666</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stata foedera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stati cursus siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 291</bibl></cit> (different: statae stellae = <hi rend="ital">fixed stars</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> D. N. 8</bibl>, belonging to II. 2. supra): statae febres, <hi rend="ital">intermittent fevers</hi>, returning regularly, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 27, 28, § 107</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44480.48" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">average</hi>, <hi rend="ital">normal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter enim pulcherrimam feminam et deformissimam media forma quaedam est, quae et a nimio pulcritudinis periculo et a summo deformitatis odio vacat, qualis a Q. Ennio perquam eleganti vocabulo stata dicitur...Ennius autem eas fere feminas ait incolumi pudicitia esse quae statā formā forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 12</bibl></cit>-14 (v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:page=133" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. p. 133</bibl> Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
sistratus: <entryFree id="n44481" type="hapax" key="sistra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sistrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sistrum</etym>, <sense id="n44481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bearing a</hi> sistrum: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>priests of Isis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:29:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 29, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sistrum: <entryFree id="n44482" type="greek" key="si_strum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīstrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sei=stron</foreign>, <sense id="n44482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metallic rattle which was used by the Egyptians in celebrating the rites of Isis</hi>, and in other lascivious festivals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 692</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 777</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 783</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:54:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:102" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 258; <cit><quote lang="la">11, p. 261 al.—By the Jews,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence sarcastically, as if used for a war - trumpet by the wanton Cleopatra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 696</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4, 10), 43; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sisura: <entryFree id="n44483" type="greek" key="si^sura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭsura</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭsurna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/sura, si/surna</foreign>, <sense id="n44483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaggy outer garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coverlet of skins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sisygambis: <entryFree id="n44484" type="main" key="Sisygambis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sisygambis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian female name;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">the mother of Darius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:18" default="NO">5, 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sisymbrium: <entryFree id="n44485" type="greek" key="si^symbri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭsymbrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sisu/mbrion</foreign>, <sense id="n44485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fragrant herb sacred to Venus</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">wildthyme</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 91, § 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:172" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 55, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:176" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 10, 57, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:869" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 869</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sisyphus: <entryFree id="n44486" type="main" key="Si_sy^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīsyphus</orth> (anciently <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīsŭpus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīsĭpus</orth>; the last in Inscr. R. N. 4472 Momms.; cf. Ritschl, Monum. Epigr. Tria, p. 26), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/sufos</foreign>. <sense id="n44486.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Æolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for his cunning and robberies. He was killed by Theseus. His punishment in the infernal regions was to roll a stone up hill which constantly rolled back again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 60" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 616</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 459</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 465</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:68 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 68 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixi Sisyphique prudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <cb n="SITI" /> vafer, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 21</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44486.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīsy-phĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sisyphus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit> (3, 9), 7; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 20 (3, 13), 32: cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 942" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 942</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:380" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isthmus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 51</bibl></cit>: opes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Creusa</hi> (as daughter of Creon, king of Corinth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes sanguine cretus Sisyphio (because Sisyphus seduced Anticlea, the mother of Ulysses, before her marriage with Laertes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 529</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44486.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭsyphēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sisyphus</hi>: vincla, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the marriage with Sisyphus</hi> (of his wife Merope), <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 597</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44486.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīsyphĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">offspring of Sisyphus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulysses (v. supra, 1.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 313</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44486.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dwarf of M. Antony</hi>, so named by him because of his shrewdness. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 47</bibl> Schol.</sense></entryFree>
sisyrinchion: <entryFree id="n44487" type="greek" key="sisyrinchi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sisyrinchĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sisuri/gxion</foreign>, <sense id="n44487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bulbous plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sisyrus: <entryFree id="n44488" type="main" key="sisyrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sisyrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> erice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sitanius: <entryFree id="n44489" type="greek" key="si_ta^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sītănĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">shta/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n44489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of this year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this year's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>of summer wheat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sitarchia: <entryFree id="n44490" type="greek" key="si_tarchi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sītarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sitarxi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n44490.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Provisions for a journey</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 29</bibl>; Hier. Comment. in Matt. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; Vit. Malch. 10; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44490.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a receptacle for such provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scrip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sitella: <entryFree id="n44491" type="main" key="si^tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>situla</etym>, <sense id="n44491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of urn used in drawing lots.</hi> It was made narrow at the top, so that but one lot at a time could be on the surface of the water with which it was partly filled, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 43</bibl>; 2, 6, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 6, 44: sitellam detulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de M. Octavio deferre sitellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitella lata est, ut sortirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3, 16</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 41, 18, 8.</sense></entryFree>
sitellitergus: <entryFree id="n44492" type="main" key="Si^telli^tergus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭtellĭtergus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>situla-tergo, the cleaner of buckets</etym>, <sense id="n44492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy by Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 66</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. Ritschl, Parerga <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">corrupted into Silitergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl></cit> Müll.; and (from the writing siti litergus) into Lipargus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 893</bibl> P.; cf. Freund, Rhein. Mus. Neue Folge 10, p. 445 sq.</sense></entryFree>
sithone: <entryFree id="n44493" type="main" key="Si_tho_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīthōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sithonii: <entryFree id="n44494" type="main" key="Si_tho^ni^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīthŏnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*siqo/nioi</foreign>, <sense id="n44494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the Thracians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18</bibl>. 9.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44494.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīthŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sithonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44494.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīthon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sithonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sithones et Scythici triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:719" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 719</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44494.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sī-thŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sithonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 605</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sitibundus: <entryFree id="n44495" type="main" key="si^ti^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirsty</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Fort. Vit. Rhadeg. 21.</sense></entryFree>
siticines: <entryFree id="n44496" type="hapax" key="si^ti^ci^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭcĭnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. situs-cano</etym>, <sense id="n44496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">musicians at funerals</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 54, 26 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
siticulosus: <entryFree id="n44497" type="main" key="si^ti_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtīcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sitis</etym> (not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n44497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Thirsty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44497.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 61, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44497.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">very dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appulia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siticulosum et peraridum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 64, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44497.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing thirst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melimela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 55, § 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sitiens: <entryFree id="n44498" type="main" key="si^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. sitio.</entryFree>
sitienter: <entryFree id="n44499" type="main" key="si^ti^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sitio, <sense id="n44499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sitio: <entryFree id="n44500" type="main" key="si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n44500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sitis]. </sense><sense id="n44500.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thirst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be thirsty</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44500.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego esurio et sitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitit haec anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio sitit flumine potans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne homines sitirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae cum sitiunt aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:27" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitire mediis in undis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be poor in the midst of wealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 760</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44500.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (esp. in the lang. of country people), of things (the earth, plants, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to be dried up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to want moisture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem est eorum (rusticorum) gemmare vites, sitire agros, laetas esse segetes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitire segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: tosta sitit tellus, Ov. <pb n="1713" /> <cb n="SITI" /> F. 4, 940: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 87" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 87</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: aret ager; <cit><quote lang="la">vitio moriens sitit aëris herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sitiunt herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 40, § 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 103</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi fontes jam sitiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pati sitire salgama,</quote> <trans><tr>to be dry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44500.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thirst after</hi> a thing (rare, but in the trop. signif. class.; cf.: cupio, desidero). </sense><sense id="n44500.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriferum Tagum sitiam patriumque Salonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:96:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 96, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo plus sunt potae, plus sitiuntur aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>are thirsted for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:216" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor quomodo sititur destillans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44500.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as in all langg., <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirst for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem nostrum sitiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (opp. satiare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 103" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 103</bibl>: cruorem, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitit hasta cruores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:595" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus libertatem sitiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit> ext. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 41, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quidem fallacis undae sitit, sed verae beatitudinis esurit et sitit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 54, 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">thirsting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirsty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">athirst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44500.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipse ad portam sitiens pervenerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pocula) arenti sitientes hausimus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecla ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:947" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 947</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitienti aqua datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44500.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), of places, plants, etc., <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without moisture</hi> (syn. aridus): <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 60</bibl></cit>.—By metonymy also, Afri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cloudless</tr>, <tr>bright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 8, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:112" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 14, 24, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canicula,</quote> <trans><tr>arid</tr>, <tr>parching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 231</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lonchitis nascitur in sitientibus,</quote> <trans><tr>in dry</tr>, <tr>arid places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 88, § 137</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in sitientibus aut siccis asperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 28, 61, § 132</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitientia Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 73, 94, § 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44500.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thirsting for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desiring eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravius ardentiusque sitiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amator) avidus sitiensque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna Ditis, Petr. poët. 121, 116: aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice sitiens lagena,</quote> <trans><tr>of moderate capacity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:92" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 92</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:578" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae (with avarus et avidus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 251</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">thirstily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedily</hi> (acc. to B.): <cit><quote lang="la">sitienter quid expetens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">incumbere hauriendis voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haurire salutares illas aquas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 135, 35.</sense></entryFree>
sitiogagus: <entryFree id="n44501" type="main" key="Sitiogagus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sitiogagus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sitis: <entryFree id="n44502" type="main" key="si^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> site, Ven. Carm. 2, 13, 3; <case>acc.</case> sitem, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 250), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin with siccus</etym>, <sense id="n44502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirst</hi> (class.; used only in <number>sing.</number>). </sense><sense id="n44502.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">demum fodere puteum, ubi sitis fauces tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi cum fauces urit sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siti sicca sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anum interfecero siti fameque atque algu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cibo et potione fames sitisque depulsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explere diuturnam sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sitim nostro possis explere cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quarta sitim caeli collegerit hora,</quote> <trans><tr>excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessa labore sitim collegerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had become thirsty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinguere sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">finire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:850" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 850</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:945" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 945</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 415</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem ac sitim sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 119, § 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relevare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:354" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 354</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">compescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere fonte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:170" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:572" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomi sitim faciunt,</quote> <trans><tr>provoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 70, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus, qui sitim stimulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim adferunt (fici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lassitudine et in siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excessit sitim potio,</quote> <trans><tr>was more than enough for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardere siti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis arida guttur Urit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44502.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things (places, plants, etc.), <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aridity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. <cb n="SITU" /> prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et Canis arenti torreat arva siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 353</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta siti regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haurit sitis ignea campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:699" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis aestatis restinguitur fontibus, i. e. of plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 8, § 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44502.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ardent desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greediness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatis sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti sitis importuna famesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis major famae quam virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sitistus: <entryFree id="n44503" type="greek" key="si_tistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sītistus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sitisto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattened</hi> (pure Lat. altilis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sitites: <entryFree id="n44504" type="greek" key="si_ti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sītītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">siti/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n44504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 43</bibl> (Jahn, syrtites).</sense></entryFree>
sititor: <entryFree id="n44505" type="main" key="si^ti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sitio</etym>, <sense id="n44505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thirster</hi> after any thing (post-Aug.). * </sense><sense id="n44505.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44505.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sitona: <entryFree id="n44506" type="greek" key="si_to_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sītōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sitw/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n44506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purchaser of grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commissary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purveyor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:8:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 8, 9, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sitones: <entryFree id="n44507" type="main" key="Sitones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sitones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of northern Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of the Suiones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sitonia: <entryFree id="n44508" type="greek" key="si_to_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sītōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sitwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n44508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> sitona, <hi rend="ital">commissariat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purveyance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sittace: <entryFree id="n44509" type="foreign" key="sitta^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sittăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, <sense id="n44509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parrot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 58, § 117</bibl> dub. (Jan. septages).</sense></entryFree>
sittius: <entryFree id="n44510" type="main" key="Sitti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sittĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n44510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g. P Sittius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 3</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 25; <cit><quote lang="la">30. To him is addressed the letter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 17, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sittĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sittius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syngrapha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">After him was named Sittianorum colonia = Cirta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 3, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sittybus: <entryFree id="n44511" type="main" key="sitty^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sittybus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strip of parchment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached to a roll or book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing the title and the author's name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8</bibl>, a, 2 B. and K. (in some editions sillybus; cf. <foreign lang="greek">sillu/bous</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4</bibl>, b, 1).</sense></entryFree>
situatus: <entryFree id="n44512" type="main" key="si^tu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fr. Erem. Serm. 37" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fr. Erem. Serm. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
situla: <entryFree id="n44513" type="main" key="si^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n44513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtŭ-lus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Fest. s. v. nanum, pp. 176 and 177 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>). </sense><sense id="n44513.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bucket</hi> for drawing water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Poët. ap. Anthol. Burm. 1, p. 493; Non. s. v. creterra, p. 375, 6 Gerl.; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 268 (2d edit.).—</sense><sense id="n44513.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An urn</hi>, used in drawing lots (instead of the usual sitella), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
situlus: <entryFree id="n44514" type="main" key="si^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. situla <sense id="n44514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
situs: <entryFree id="n44515" type="main" key="si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44516" type="main" key="si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sino</etym>. <sense id="n44516.0" n="I" level="1"> (Sino, 1. situs, A.; prop. a being laid or placed, a lying; hence, by meton.) </sense><sense id="n44516.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The manner of lying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the situation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">local position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">site</hi> of a thing (class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; mostly of localities; syn. positus). </sense><sense id="n44516.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Syracusas elegerat, cujus hic situs esse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:12" default="NO">7, 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messana, quae situ moenibus portuque ornata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes naturali situ inexpugnabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri (with forma),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca naturae situ invia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. opus: turrem et situ et opere multum editum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:23" default="NO">8, 10, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura situsque membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:61:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 61, 153</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">passeres a rhombis situ tantum corporum differunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 20, 36, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilonis,</quote> <trans><tr>towards the north</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 59</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: exegi monumentum aere perennius Regalique situ pyramidum altius, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the structure</hi> (prop. the manner of construction), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 2</bibl> (cf. the <mood>Part.</mood> situs, in Tac., = conditus, built; v. <itype>sino</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A. 2. c.).—</sense><sense id="n44516.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunissimi situs urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oppidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>: situs partium corporis,<cb n="SIVE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocare situs (foliorum),</quote> <trans><tr>position</tr>, <tr>arrangement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 451</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44516.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (= regio), <hi rend="ital">a quarter of the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">a meridiano situ ad septentriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 47, 48, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 12, 17, § 108</bibl>; cf. Sill. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, § 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pantherae) repleturae illos situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44516.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Soil</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae loca pingui situ et cultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44516.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Description</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus originem in Africae situ digessimus plene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44516.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44516.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mustiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, etc., that a thing acquires from lying too long in one place (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: squalor, sordes): corrumpor situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in usu sunt et manum cottidie tactumque patiuntur, numquam periculum situs adeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia duri Militis in tenebris occupat arma situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:50" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma squalere situ ac rubigine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immundo pallida mitra situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 70: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aut supellex vestisve condita situ dilabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per loca senta situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">araneosus situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:8:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">detergere situm ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:534" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterso situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata situ vetustatis obducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44516.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Filthiness</hi> of the body: genas situ liventes, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 225 Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">situm inter oris et barba, etc.): en ego victa situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 290</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 802</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44516.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44516.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absence of use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigna est pigro forma perire situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et segnem patiere situ durescere campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius usu splendescit, situ rubiginat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 351, 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44516.12" n="2" level="3"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">a rusting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moulding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wasting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus victa situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcescere otio situque civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situ obsitae justitia, aequitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (mens) in hujusmodi secretis languescit et quendam velut in opaco situm ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pereant turpi pectora nostra situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depellere situm curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebis in aeterno surda jacere situ (carmina),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>oblivion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(verba) priscis memorata Catonibus Nunc situs informis premit et deserta vetustas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam passure situm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:100" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus est leges istas situ atque senio emori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sive: <entryFree id="n44517" type="main" key="si_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīve</orth> (old orthog. SEIVE, Tab. Bantin. l. 6; and hence, by apocope, like neu, from neve, NEIVE). <orth extent="full" lang="la">seu</orth> (the latter form very rare in Cic.; more freq. in Cæs.; as freq. as sive in the poets), <sense id="n44517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [si-ve], a disjunctive conditional particle, <hi rend="ital">or if</hi> = vel si. </sense><sense id="n44517.1" n="I" level="1"> Put once, preserving the conditional signif. of the si (cf., on the other hand, infra, II. B. 2.). </sense><sense id="n44517.2" n="A" level="2"> After a preceding <hi rend="ital">si</hi> (mostly ante-class.): si vivimus sive morimur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 880</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 384 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si media nox est, sive est prima vespera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ista uxor sive amica est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: si nocte sive luce, si servus sive liber faxit, Rogat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si arborum trunci, sive naves essent a barbaris missae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego volo seu nolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si movero me, seu secari sensero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si speras ... seu tibi confidis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:837" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 837</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te, etc. ... sive haec, etc. ... seu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 58</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44517.3" n="B" level="2"> Without a preceding <hi rend="ital">si</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc postulo, sive aequom'st, te oro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">peto a te, vel si pateris, oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">bis denas Italo texamus robore naves, Seu plures complere valent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me seu corpus spoliatum lumine mavis, Redde meis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 935</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pars dialectica, sive illam dicere malumus disputatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdus, Sive aliud privum dabitur tibi, devolet illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 6, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44517.4" n="II" level="1"> Repeated, with a disjunctive sense predominant. </sense><sense id="n44517.5" n="A" level="2"> Connecting words or phrases in the same construction. or conditional clauses which have the same predicate: sive (seu) ... sive (seu) (in good prose, esp. in Cic., usually sive ... sive; in Cæs. often seu ... seu; after the Aug. period often sive ... seu, or seu ... <pb n="1714" /> <cb n="SIVE" /> sive); prop. if this or if that be the case, placing the counter propositions on an equality, <hi rend="ital">be it that ... or that; if ... or if; whether ... or</hi>, i. e. in either case (the predominant use and signif. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n44517.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui improbus est, sive subbibit, sive adeo caret temeto, tamen ab ingenio est improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sive ... sive etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive quid mecum ipse cogito, sive quid aut scribo aut lego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive eum ex paludibus elicere sive obsidione premere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive regi sive optimatibus serviant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo exardescit sive amor sive amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive tu medicum adhibueris, sive non adhibueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive sub incertas Zephyris mutantibus umbras, Sive antro potius succedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu recte, seu pervorse facta sunt, Egomet fecisse confiteor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem esse rem, seu maneant, seu proficiscantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 36</bibl>; 7, 89; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 103, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 881 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantitas plerumque eidem subjacet, seu modi est seu numeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive dolo, seu jam Trojae sic fata ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive deae seu sint dirae volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 262</bibl></cit>; 4, 240; 7, 199; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:35" default="NO">1, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:41" default="NO">1, 5, 41</bibl>; 2, 1, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 26: seu magni superas jam saxa Timavi, Sive oram Illyrici legis aequoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">seu ... sive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 528</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 321</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 639</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 324 al.</bibl> (In Cæs. B. C. 2, 27, the MSS. vary between seu ... sive and sive ... sive.)—</sense><sense id="n44517.7" n="2" level="3"> Repeated several times: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ancillam sive servum sive uxorem sive adulterum, Seu patrem sive avum videbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:5:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 5, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 69 sq.; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (Cimmeriis) aspectum solis sive deus aliquis sive natura ademerat, sive loci situs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: seu furor est: habeo, quae carmine sanet et herbis; Sive aliquis nocuit: magico lustrabere ritu; <cit><quote lang="la">Ira deum sive est: sacris placabimus iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 397</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n44517.8" n="3" level="3"> With a corresp. <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: sive tu vatem, sive tu omen audieris; sive immolaris, sive avem aspexeris; <cit><quote lang="la">si Chaldaeum, si haruspicem videris, si fulserit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44517.9" n="B" level="2"> Connecting complete conditional sentences, each with its own conclusion, but always implying that the alternative conclusions are alike steps in the general argument, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the one hand ... if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if ... but if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam sive timuit, quid ignavius? sive meliorem suam causam fore putavit, quid injustius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: sive enim ad sapientiam perveniri potest, non paranda nobis solum ea, sed fruenda etiam est; <cit><quote lang="la">sive hoc difficile est, tamen nec modus est ullus investigandi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eis sive creditur, creditur hoc ipsum quod nos arguimus, sive fides non habetur, de adversarii testium fide derogatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caec. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sive abstinuisset Epiro, integra sibi omnia essent: sive venisset, sic quoque spes veniae foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 6, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 3, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">37, 15, 2: eos seu dedi placeat, dedere se paratos esse, seu supplicio adfici, daturos poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 40, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44517.10" n="2" level="3"> Instead of <hi rend="ital">sive</hi> as a correl., <hi rend="ital">sin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">si vero</hi> is sometimes found: <cit><quote lang="la">sive sensus exstinguitur ... quis me beatior? sin vera sunt quae dicuntur, migrationem esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive enim Zenonem sequare, magnum est efficere ... si vero Academiam veterem persequamur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: sive enim abscedant, cui dubium esse quin, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem manendum ibi nihilo minus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44517.11" n="3" level="3"> In this use * <cit><quote lang="la">si ... sive is found once: si omnes atomi declinabunt, nullae umquam cohaerescent, sive aliae declinabunt, aliae suo nutu recte ferentur, primum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit> B. and K.; cf.: si ... sive in one sentence, I. A. supra; and v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44517.12" n="C" level="2"> On account of the predominant disjunctive sense, </sense><sense id="n44517.13" n="1" level="3"> In the poets and in post-Aug. prose, instead of one <hi rend="ital">sive</hi>, sometimes <hi rend="ital">aut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vel</hi>, or one of the interrogative particles <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an</hi> is used: <cit><quote lang="la">(saxum) seu turbidus imber Proluit, aut annis solvit sublapsa vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ... sive ... vel, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:79" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: misero conjux, fatone erepta Creusa Substitit, erravitne viā, seu lassa resedit, Incertum,<cb n="SMYR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 739</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive fatali vecordiā an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26</bibl></cit>;
