so, <cit><quote lang="la">sive ... seu ... an,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44517.14" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes also <hi rend="ital">sive</hi> stands alone in a purely disjunctive sense, = vel (in Cicero only in the phrases sive quis, sive potius, sive etiam): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi Platonis illud, seu quis dixit alius, perelegans esse videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>or whoever else said it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid perturbatius hoc ab urbe discessu, sive potius turpissimā fugā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te primum rogo, ut (animum) erigas ac resistas, sive etiam ultro occurras negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristarchus et aetate nostrā Palaemon vocabulum, sive appellationem, nomini subjecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectandi sive conciliandi officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miracula visa sive ex metu credita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium sive naufragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana bella sive Asiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
smaragdinus: <entryFree id="n44518" type="greek" key="sma^ragdi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smăragdĭnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">zmăr-</orth>; <sense id="n44518.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">smar- with long a,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 862</bibl></cit>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">smara/gdinos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emerald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smaragdine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum (on account of its green color),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prata, Prud. l. l.: lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Postclass. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">smăragdĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">viriditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 66</bibl></cit>: postis, Ven. Carm. 8, 8, 18.</sense></entryFree>
smaragdites: <entryFree id="n44519" type="greek" key="Sma^ragdi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Smăragdītes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Zmăr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mons), <sense id="n44519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain on which the smaragdus was found</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
smaragdus: <entryFree id="n44520" type="greek" key="sma^ragdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smăragdus</orth> (in many MSS. written also <orth extent="full" lang="la">zmăr-</orth>: <sense id="n44520.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">smărăgdus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 121</bibl>; <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:28:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 563</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">sma/ragdo/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a transparent precious stone of a bright green color;</hi> including not only our <hi rend="ital">emerald</hi>, but also the <hi rend="ital">beryl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jasper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malachite</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:73" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 18, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 805</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1126" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:27" default="NO">2, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:276 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 276 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
smaris: <entryFree id="n44521" type="greek" key="sma^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smăris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">zmăris</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smari/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sea-fish of inferior quality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:120" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 34, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:128" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 45, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
smecticus: <entryFree id="n44522" type="greek" key="smecti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smectĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">smhktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstersive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
smegma: <entryFree id="n44523" type="greek" key="smegma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smegma</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">smigma</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">zmeg-ma</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype> (<sense id="n44523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> smegmatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 92</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smh=gma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a cleansing medicine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a detergent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:134" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 13, 36, § 134</bibl>.—For making the skin smooth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 28, § 43</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 64 (2d edit.): afferte mihi smigmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
smerdaleos: <entryFree id="n44524" type="greek" key="smerda^le^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smerdălĕos</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">smerdale/os</foreign>, <sense id="n44524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 69 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
smerdis: <entryFree id="n44525" type="main" key="Smerdis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Smerdis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n44525.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brother of Cambyses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Persia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by whom he was put to death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44525.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An impostor named Oropastes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who assumed the name of Smerdis after the death of Cambyses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl>, §§ 9, 10.</sense></entryFree>
smigma: <entryFree id="n44526" type="main" key="smigma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smigma</orth>, v. smegma <sense id="n44526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
smila: <entryFree id="n44527" type="greek" key="smi_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smīla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smi/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n44527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knife</hi> (syn. scalprum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 172</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
smilax: <entryFree id="n44528" type="greek" key="smi_lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smīlax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smi=lac</foreign>. <sense id="n44528.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bindweed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withwind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough smilax</hi>: Smilax aspera, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 35, 63, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:82" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 49, § 82</bibl>.—Hence Smilax personified, <hi rend="ital">a maiden who was changed into this herb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 283</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44528.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The yew-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 51</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44528.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of oak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
smilion: <entryFree id="n44529" type="greek" key="smi_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smīlĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smili/on</foreign>, <sense id="n44529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of medicinal salve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
smintheus: <entryFree id="n44530" type="main" key="Smintheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Smintheus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zmin-</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sminqeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Apollo</hi> (from the Cretan <foreign lang="greek">smi/nqos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">mouse</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the mousekiller;</hi> or, as Aristarchus asserts, from Smintha (<foreign lang="greek">*smi/nqh</foreign>), a town in the Troad, <hi rend="ital">the Sminthean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:425" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 425</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Sminthea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 585</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44530.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sminthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Smintheus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Astynome</tr>, <tr>daughter of Chryses</tr>, <tr>priest of Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 176" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44530.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sminthius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Zmin-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Smintheus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mures (acc. to the myth, killed by Apollo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
smyrna: <entryFree id="n44531" type="main" key="smyrna1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smyrna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smu/rna</foreign>, <sense id="n44531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">myrrh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 504</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44532" type="main" key="Smyrna2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Smyrna</orth> (in the best MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zmyr-na</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*smu/rna</foreign>, <sense id="n44532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated maritime city of Ionia;</hi> according to some, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Homer</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Smyrna</hi>, <cb n="SOBR" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:35" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:9 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 9 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Smyrnaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Zmyr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Smyrna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Smyrnean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Homer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 984</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same, plectra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:595" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 595</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, tubae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 131</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Smyr-naei</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Zmyr-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Smyrna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44532.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient name of Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
smyrnion: <entryFree id="n44533" type="greek" key="smyrni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smyrnĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">zmyrnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smurni/on</foreign>, <sense id="n44533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of herb like myrrh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common Alexanders</hi>: Smyrnium olus atrum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:162" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 48, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
smyrrhiza: <entryFree id="n44534" type="greek" key="smyrrhi_za"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smyrrhīza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smurrica</foreign>, <sense id="n44534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> myrrha <hi rend="ital">and</hi> myrrhis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 97, § 154</bibl> (Jahn, myrrhiza).</sense></entryFree>
smyrus: <entryFree id="n44535" type="greek" key="smyrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">smyrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">zmyr-</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">smu=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n44535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soboles: <entryFree id="n44536" type="main" key="so^bo^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏbŏles</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŏbŏlesco</orth>, v. subol-.</entryFree>
sobreus: <entryFree id="n44537" type="main" key="so_bre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĕus</orth>, v. sobrius.</entryFree>
sobrie: <entryFree id="n44538" type="main" key="so_bri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sobrius <sense id="n44538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sobriefactus: <entryFree id="n44539" type="hapax" key="so_bri^e^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĭĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [sobrius, II., -facio], <sense id="n44539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made reasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sobered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sobriefactus sermone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sobrietas: <entryFree id="n44540" type="main" key="so_bri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sobrius</etym>, <sense id="n44540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sobriety</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n44540.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">temperance</hi> in drinking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence Sobrietas personified,</quote> <trans><tr>the enemy of Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 450</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44540.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continence</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modestas, temperantia): vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44540.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">reasonableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sobrinus: <entryFree id="n44541" type="main" key="so_bri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. for sororinus from soror, and therefore prop. an appellation for the children of sisters; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n44541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cousin-german</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cousin</hi> by the mother's side, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 6</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n44541.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO">38, 10, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44541.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl> and 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sobrio: <entryFree id="n44542" type="main" key="so_bri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sobrius</etym>, <sense id="n44542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sober</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make sober</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 685</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sobrius: <entryFree id="n44543" type="main" key="so_bri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n44543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> sobrior, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 64</bibl>; elsewhere not compared), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sw/frwn, sa/os</foreign>; Lat. sanus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sober</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44543.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, opp. vinolentus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. vino madens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. madidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; Cato Utic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 53</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. ebrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 4</bibl></cit> (with siccus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. temulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">male sobrius, i. e. ebrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:785" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 785</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44543.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ebrius): pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 28</bibl></cit> (24): <cit><quote lang="la">lympha mixta mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans><tr>in which there was no drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 11; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">convictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <trans><tr>not intoxicating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <trans><tr>that furnish no wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:37" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sobrium vicum Romae dictum putant, vel quod in eo nulla taberna fuerit, vel quod in eo Mercurio lacte, non vino supplicabatur, Fest. pp. 296 and 297 Müll.: non sobria verba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a drunken person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:28:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lares pauperes nostros, sed plane sobrios revisamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44543.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sober</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcus ac sobrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: vigilans ac sollers, sicca, sana, sobria, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 33</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 148 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines frugi ac sobrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:27:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 27, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auream quisquis mediocritatem Diligit ... caret invidendā Sobrius aulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aestimatur voluptas illa Epicuri, quam sobria et sicca sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus illa Romana virtus et sobria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. libidinosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44543.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the mind, <hi rend="ital">sober</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even-minded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis compos, sanus): satin' sanus es aut sobrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis credis sobriam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu homo non es sobrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantes homines, sobrii, industrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 74</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1715" /> <cb n="SOCI" /> diligentes et memores et sobrii oratores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 140</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. iracundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte sobria ferre pedem,</quote> <trans><tr>prudently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">opera Proba et sapiens et sobria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium siccum ac sobrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violenta et rapida Carneades dicebat, modesta Diogenes et sobria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōbrĭē</orth> (acc. to II. A. and B.). </sense><sense id="n44543.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Moderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frugally</hi>: vivere (with parce, continenter, severe; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. diffluere luxuriā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44543.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Prudently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspectly</hi>, = prudenter: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc sobrie agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rem accurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soccatus: <entryFree id="n44544" type="main" key="socca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">soccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>soccus</etym>, <sense id="n44544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing</hi> socci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soccifer: <entryFree id="n44545" type="main" key="socci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">soccĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>soccus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n44545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sock-wearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menander,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 215</bibl></cit>; v. soccus.</sense></entryFree>
socculus: <entryFree id="n44546" type="main" key="soccu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">soccŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>soccus</etym>, <sense id="n44546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> soccus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 114</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the sock</hi> worn by comic actors (v. soccus, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soccus: <entryFree id="n44547" type="main" key="soccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">soccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n44547.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of low-heeled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light shoe</hi>, worn by the Greeks; <hi rend="ital">a slipper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soccos, quibus indutus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 10</bibl> et saep.—When worn by Romans they were a sign of effeminacy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 17</bibl>.—The soccus was worn especially by comic actors (the cothurnus, on the contrary, by tragic actors).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44547.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">comedy</hi> (as cothurnus, tragedy), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comicus soccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tragoedia socco ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: risus socci; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. luctus cothurni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 299</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
socer: <entryFree id="n44548" type="main" key="so^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcer</orth> (<case>nom.</case> socerus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 54</bibl>; <sense id="n44548.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">with socer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 56</bibl></cit>), <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(kuro/s</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n44548.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A father-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl> and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 30 al.</bibl>; v. also socrus.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> soceri, <hi rend="ital">parents-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 457</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44548.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for consocer, <hi rend="ital">a son's father-in-law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 4</bibl>: magnus, <hi rend="ital">grandfather-in-law</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one's husband's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wife's grandfather</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called simply socer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:146" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:14" default="NO">23, 2, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">socer major,</quote> <trans><tr>a great-grandfather-in-law</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. p. 136, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
socera: <entryFree id="n44549" type="gloss" key="so^ce^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. socrus.</entryFree>
socerus: <entryFree id="n44550" type="main" key="so^ce^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. socer <sense id="n44550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
socia: <entryFree id="n44551" type="main" key="so^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. socius.</entryFree>
sociabilis: <entryFree id="n44552" type="main" key="so^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>socio</etym>, <sense id="n44552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be easily united</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joined together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sociable</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">natura nos sociabiles fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consortio inter reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abies maxime sociabilis glutino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">connectedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 5:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
socialis: <entryFree id="n44553" type="main" key="so^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>socius</etym>, <sense id="n44553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to companionship.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44553.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">companionable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sociable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">social</hi> (so not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo sociale animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium dare socialis res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 5:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44553.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44553.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to allies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confederates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederate</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex judiciumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the allies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">turmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae (opp. legiones),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>auxiliaries</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>the war of the allies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta socialia prospere composita,</quote> <trans><tr>the affairs of the allies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44553.4" n="B" level="2"> In Ovid several times like conjugialis, <hi rend="ital">of marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjugal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nuptial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor socialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 800</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with foedus maritum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livia sic tecum sociales compleat annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 380</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:729" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina, i. e. epithalamium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 139</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏ-cĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">socially</hi>: non ut de sede secundā<cb n="SOCI" />  Cederet aut quartā socialiter (iambus), <hi rend="ital">for the sake of company</hi> (perh. <foreign lang="greek">a(/p. ei)rhm</foreign>.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
socialitas: <entryFree id="n44554" type="main" key="so^ci^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>socialis</etym>, <sense id="n44554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sociableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sociality</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
socialiter: <entryFree id="n44555" type="main" key="so^ci^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. socialis <sense id="n44555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sociatio: <entryFree id="n44556" type="main" key="so^ci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>socio</etym>, <sense id="n44556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">union</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rata inter eos (post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sociatrix: <entryFree id="n44557" type="main" key="so^ci^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who associates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:500" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 500</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sociennus: <entryFree id="n44558" type="hapax" key="so^ci^ennus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭennus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>socius</etym>, <sense id="n44558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
societas: <entryFree id="n44559" type="main" key="so^ci^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">association</hi>, <hi rend="ital">union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">community</hi>, <hi rend="ital">society</hi> (implying union for a common purpose; cf.: conjunctio, consociatio; and not a mere assembly; cf.: circulus, coetus; conventus, sodalitas; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44559.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum inter ipsos societas conjunctioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nos) natos esse ad societatem communitatemque generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas generis humani, quam conciliavit ipsa natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides et societas generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas et communicatio utilitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla societas nobis cum tyrannis, sed potius summa distractio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem cum aliquo coire ... dirimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem coire de municipis cognitique fortunis cum alienissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi societatem coit conparandi cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:35:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 35, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarias pactiones societatesque conflare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum omnium societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beate et honeste vivendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatis cum humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium facinorum sibi cum Dolabellā societatem initam confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominum,</quote> <trans><tr>names in common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 218</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: nulla sancta societas nec fides regni est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl> (Trag. v. 411 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque naturae est societas ulla cum somniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 71, 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44559.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44559.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A copartnership</hi>, <hi rend="ital">association</hi> for trading purposes. </sense><sense id="n44559.4" n="1" level="3"> In abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui societatem cum Sex. Naevio fecerit, etc.... fecit societatem earum rerum, quae in Galliā comparabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magnā fide societatem gererent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum annos jam compluris societas esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pecunia) tibi ex societate debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:74" default="NO">17, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 2, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:5" default="NO">17, 2, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">societates contrahuntur sive universorum bonorum, sive negotiationis alicujus, sive vectigalis, sive etiam rei unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44559.5" n="2" level="3"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a company</hi> or <hi rend="ital">society</hi> of the farmers of the public revenue: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla Romae societas vectigalium, nullum collegium aut concilium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnes societates venerunt, quarum ex numero multi sedent judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 33, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximarum societatum auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 118</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44559.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A political league</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an alliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Ptolemaeo societas erat facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 107 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiorigem sibi societate et foedere adjungunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leptitani Romam miserant amicitiam societatemque rogatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 77:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 77, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impellere ad societatem belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Lacedaemonii in societate non manerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ioniam a societate averterunt Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem alicujus induere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
socio: <entryFree id="n44560" type="main" key="so^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unite together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to associate; to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold in common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to share</hi> a thing with another, etc. (freq. and class.; in Cic. mostly with inanimate objects; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. jungo): coetus utilitatis communione sociatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 25, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilia coetusque hominum jure sociati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus hominum sociatum inter se esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) regnum suum cum illorum (Sabinorum) rege sociavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nos domo socias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si testium studium cum accusatore sociatum est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: cum vel periculum vitae tuae mecum sociare voluisses, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="SOCI" /> <hi rend="ital">risk your life for me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 30, 73</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum ut longae sociarem gaudia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vim rerum cognitionemque cum scientiā atque exercitatione sociaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam cum scientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne societur sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of union by marriage: se alicui vinclo jugali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuoque mihi sociatam foedere lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencos aratro imposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:132" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:149" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:290" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se participem in omnis casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:75" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem ulmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <trans><tr>to share</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:282" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba loquor socianda chordis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be accompanied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carmina nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo simili sui sociabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theseus sociati parte laboris Functus,</quote> <trans><tr>undertaken in company with another</tr>, <tr>common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidium (shortly before: societas facinoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">sociari facinoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to take part in deeds of villany</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sociofraudus: <entryFree id="n44561" type="hapax" key="so^ci^o^fraudus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭŏfraudus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>socius-fraudo</etym>, <sense id="n44561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that deceives his comrades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
socius: <entryFree id="n44562" type="main" key="so^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root sec- of sequor</etym>, <sense id="n44562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joining in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">united</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Augustus) socium cum Jove nomen habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:608" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea possedit socio Capitolia templo Mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in common with Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:352" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 795</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:618" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociis quid noctibus uxor anxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus clara in Lyciā gelidi fontis sociā amoenitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44562.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">leagued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura sociae retinendae urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 371</bibl></cit>: manus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the allies</hi> (in the Bellum Sociale), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:635" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 635</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt</hi> </sense><sense id="n44562.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> socium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 21, 10</bibl>; v. II. B. infra; <cit><quote lang="la">also in the poets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 41</bibl>; Neue, Formenl. 1, 112 sq.). </sense><sense id="n44562.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associate</hi> (very freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: consors, particeps): belli particeps et socius et adjutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum omnium particeps et socius paene regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regni sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuorum consiliorum (with particeps),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum omnium (with particeps),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 37</bibl></cit> (21, 47): <cit><quote lang="la">me quidem certe tuarum actionum, sententiarum, rerum denique omnium socium comitemque habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter Laelium neminem habeo culpae socium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agusius, omnium laborum, periculorum meorum socius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socius et consors gloriosi laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli socius in Sabino proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; for which, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui socius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cape consiliis socium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos castris adhibe socios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socium esse in negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sine sociis nemo quicquam tale conatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socium ad malam rem quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sociis operum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante alios Infert se socium Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissā sociorum parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 242</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis socii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>relatives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 259</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a spouse</tr>, <tr>consort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 678</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44562.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44562.5" n="a" level="4"> In mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">a copartner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partner</hi> in business: <cit><quote lang="la">socii putandi sunt, quos inter res communicata est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarium est socium fallere qui se in negotio conjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—So, socii, of <hi rend="ital">the company</hi> of farmers of the public revenue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 120</bibl>; cf. societas, II. A. 2. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n44562.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro socio (agere, damnari, etc.),</quote> <trans><tr>for defrauding a partner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17</bibl>, <pb n="1716" /> <cb n="SOCO" /> tit. 2: Pro socio.—</sense><sense id="n44562.7" n="b" level="4"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">an ally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confederate</hi> (cf. foederatus); <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servate vestros socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boios receptos ad se socios sibi asciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 1, 14; 1, 15; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 36: Cyprius rex, cujus majores huic populo socii atque amici semper fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 20, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 1</bibl> et saep. al.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 92, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">socius et amicus populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—In the connection, socii et Latini, or, more freq., socii et nomen Latinum, the term socii denotes the Italian people dwelling out of Latium who were under the protection of and allied with Rome, <hi rend="ital">the Italian allies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii nomenque Latinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 4</bibl></cit> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also: socii ac nominis Latini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without ellipsis: per homines nominis Latini et socios Italicos impedimenta parabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quos (milites) uti ex Latio et a sociis cogeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 95:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 95, 1</bibl></cit>. —The socii Latini nominis, on the other hand, are simply <hi rend="ital">the Latin allies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Latins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii ab nomine Latino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38</bibl></cit>.—In this sense the <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> is usually socium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 27, 11</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">socii navales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 50</bibl></cit>; v. navalis.—</sense><sense id="n44562.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos, qui nos socias sumpserunt sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eloquentia) pacis est comes otiique socia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae socia virtus, mortis comes gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 39</bibl></cit> (21, 49); cf.: est socia mortis homini vita ingloria, Publ. Syr. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 213</bibl> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">nox socia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam plurimas uxores habent.... nulla pro sociā obtinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addit se sociam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socias sorores Impietatis habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic socias tu quoque junge moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociae doloris casusque tui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: socia generisque torique, <hi rend="ital">related by blood and marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relative and wife</hi> (Juno), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 620</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:521" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 521</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 268: ulmus cum sociā vite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:662" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 662</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
