socordia: <entryFree id="n44563" type="main" key="so_cordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōcordĭa</orth> (o short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 194</bibl>; cf. socors; sometimes, on account of the etymology, written also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcordĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>socors</etym>, <sense id="n44563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dulness of mind</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n44563.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Weakmindedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi> (very rare; syn.: insipientia, stoliditas): socordiam quidam pro ignaviā posuerunt (v. II.); <cit><quote lang="la">Cato pro stultitiā posuit, Fest. pp. 292 and 293 Müll.: si quem socordiae argueret, stultiorem aiebat filio suo Claudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44563.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laziness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi> (the predominant signif. of the word; used only in the <number>sing.</number>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 314</bibl> P.; perh. only once in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: ignavia, desidia, segnities): tu ad hoc diei tempus dormitasti in otio. Quin tu abs te socordiam omnem reicis segnitiem amoves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi somnum socordiamque ex pectore oculisque amovetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil loci'st segnitiae neque socordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socordia atque desidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 35</bibl></cit>; so (with desidia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl>; (with ignavia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 4</bibl>; (with incultus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl>; (opp. industria) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrā cunctatione et socordiā jam huc progressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrenenses tardius iere. Id socordiāne an casu accideret, parum cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socordiāne an vinolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunā per socordiam non uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi felicitas in socordiam vertisset, exuere jugum potuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca ac sopita socordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Darei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
socorditer: <entryFree id="n44564" type="main" key="so_cordi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōcordĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. socors <sense id="n44564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
socors: <entryFree id="n44565" type="main" key="so_cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōcors</orth> (o short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 1, 33</bibl>; cf. socordia), <itype>cordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>se, = sine, and cor(d)s</etym>, <sense id="n44565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mentally dull</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n44565.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Narrow-minded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, etc. (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: stultus, stolidus, ineptus, insipiens, insulsus): socors naturā neglegensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines non socordes ad veri investigandi cupiditatem excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolidi ac socordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socors ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius callidior, Claudius socordior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. under socordia, I., the passage ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">apud socordissimos Scythas Anacharsis sapiens natus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44565.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>,<cb n="SODA" />  <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slothful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, etc. (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: ignavus, segnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languidus et socors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 61, 8</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">neque victoriā socors aut insolens factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 100, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sejanus nimiā fortunā socors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus sine rectore praeceps, pavidum, socors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolim ceterarum rerum te socordem eodem modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregarius miles futuri socors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏcor-dĭter</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slothfully</hi> (not used in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: socordius ire milites occepere, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 235, 15</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
socra: <entryFree id="n44566" type="gloss" key="socra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">socra</orth>, v. socrus.</entryFree>
socrates: <entryFree id="n44567" type="main" key="So_cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōcrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swkra/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n44567.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The celebrated Greek philosopher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons et caput philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Apolline omnium sapientissimus dictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 50</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi> Socrate, bis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:page=477" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. p. 477</bibl> Orell.—As an appellative, in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exsistant ... Socratae simul et Antisthenae et Platones multi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 50</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōcrătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swkratiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Socrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Socratic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepor subtilitasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>devoted to philosophy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xenophon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinaedi (in reference to Alcibiades, the favorite of Socrates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōcrătĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disciples of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:61 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 61 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44567.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44567.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
socrualis: <entryFree id="n44568" type="main" key="socru^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">socrŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>socrus</etym>, <sense id="n44568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mother-in-law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munificentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
socrus: <entryFree id="n44569" type="main" key="socrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">socrus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (orig. <gen>comm.</gen>; <sense id="n44569.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a collat. form of socer; Gr.<foreign lang="greek">e(kuro/s</foreign></etym>, orig.also <gen>m.</gen>, either <hi rend="ital">a father-in-law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a mother-in-law;</hi> but of the first signif. we have only two examples in ancient poets: praemia erepta a socru suo, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 698</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. p. 136 Rib.); and: a socru, Oenomao rege, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Rib. l. l. p. 213).—The signif. <hi rend="ital">mother-in-law</hi> was the prevailing one through all periods of the language: <cit><quote lang="la">uno animo omnes socrus oderunt nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:626" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 626</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:231" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:14:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 14, § 4</bibl>.—Collat. form SOCERA, ae (acc. to socer), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 289</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and contr. SOCRA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4221</bibl></cit>: magna, <hi rend="ital">grandmother-in-law</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one's husband's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wife's grandmother</hi>: major, <hi rend="ital">the great-grandmother</hi> of either party, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sodaliciarius: <entryFree id="n44570" type="gloss" key="so^da_li^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭcĭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sodalicium</etym>, <sense id="n44570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an associalion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi>, only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44570.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, one who is bound to another by fellowship, <hi rend="ital">a comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bosomfriend</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4794</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44570.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭcĭ-ārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">SODALICIARIA CONSILII BONI,</quote> <trans><tr>a companion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4644</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sodalicium: <entryFree id="n44571" type="main" key="so^da_li^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <sense id="n44571.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art., II.</sense></entryFree>
sodalicius: <entryFree id="n44572" type="main" key="so^da_li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sodalis</etym>. <sense id="n44572.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> sodalis; <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fellowship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">companionship</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jure sodalicio mihi junctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 46</bibl></cit> (al. sodalicii); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Druidae sodaliciis astricti consortiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44572.1" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegia sodalicia,</quote> <trans><tr>pertaining to an unlawful secret association</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44572.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n44572.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly intercourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intimacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brotherhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companionship</hi>, etc. (syn. sodalitas): <cit><quote lang="la">fraternum vere dulce sodalicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:100:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 100, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44572.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44572.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An association</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">society</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">college</hi> of any kind: <cit><quote lang="la">CVLTORVM HERCVLIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2404</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FVLLONVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4056</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44572.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A company assembled for feasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a banquetingclub</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 51, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44572.7" n="3" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an unlawful secret society</hi> (for buying votes, plotting against the State, etc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hetaeriae): lex Licinia, quae est de sodaliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: in hos sodaliciorum<cb n="SODE" />  tribuario crimine, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mariana sodalicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sodalis: <entryFree id="n44573" type="main" key="so^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case>, regularly, sodali; <sense id="n44573.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">sodale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:86:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 86, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 6</bibl>), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. svadhā, will, power; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/qos</foreign>, custom; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 251" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 251</bibl></etym>. </sense><sense id="n44573.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a mate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boon-companion</hi>, etc. (freq.and class.; a favorite word with Plautus; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">socius, familiaris): tuos amicus et sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic sodalis tuos amicus optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; so (with amicus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodalem me esse scis gnato tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex sodales repperi, Vitam, amicitiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim aut illo fidelius amico aut sodale jucundius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si frater aut sodalis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 74</bibl></cit>: sodalis et familiarissimus Dolabellae, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum habui semper sodales. Sodalitates autem me quaestore constitutae sunt sacris Idaeis ... epulabar igitur cum sodalibus omnino modice, etc. (shortly after: coetu amicorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis et sodalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes aliquot, aequales sodalesque: adulescentium Tarquiniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem reversus sodalibus legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompei meorum prime sodalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudentem parvisque sodalibus et lare certo Et ludis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodalis istius (Verris) in hoc morbo et cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem tutare sodalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:4:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O jucunde sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilectos inter sors prima sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44573.2" n="b" level="4"> In the poets, adject.: <cit><quote lang="la">turba sodalis,</quote> <trans><tr>the band of friends</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 586</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44573.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44573.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fellow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">member</hi> of a corporation, society, fraternity, college, etc.: sodales sunt, qui ejusdem collegii sunt, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">e(tairi/an</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:12:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 12, 4</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the members</hi> of a college of priests: <cit><quote lang="la">sodales in Lupercis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sodales Titii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2364 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1588</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1593</bibl>; 1611 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44573.5" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a participator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplice</hi> in unlawful secret associations (esp. for buying votes, plotting against the State, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos tu si sodales vocas, officiosam amicitiam nomine inquinas criminoso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu in illis es decem sodalibus: Te in exsilium ire hinc oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44573.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A gallant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Juv. 1, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sodalitas: <entryFree id="n44574" type="main" key="so^da_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sodalis</etym>. <sense id="n44574.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companionship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brotherhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimacy;</hi> abstr. and concr. (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">societas): sodalitas familiaritasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā nobilitate homo, cognatione, sodalitate, collegio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intima sodalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl></cit>.—Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego de sodalitate solus sum orator datus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a sodalitatibus abducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44574.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44574.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">association</hi> of any kind, esp. for religious purposes (syn. sodalicium): <cit><quote lang="la">fera quaedam sodalitas et plane pastoricia germanorum Lupercorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SODALITAS PVDICITIAE SERVANDAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2401</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44574.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A company assembled for feasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a banqueting - club</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodalitates autem me quaestore constitutae sunt sacris Idaeis ... epulabar igitur cum sodalibus modice, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44574.4" n="C" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an unlawful secret society</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem die senatus consultum factum est, ut sodalitates decuriatique discederent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 15, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sodalitiarius: <entryFree id="n44575" type="gloss" key="so^da_li^ti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭtĭārĭus</orth>, v. ‡ sodaliciarius.</entryFree>
sodalitium: <entryFree id="n44576" type="main" key="so^da_li^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭtĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏdālĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sodalicius.</entryFree>
sodanus: <entryFree id="n44577" type="main" key="Sodanus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sodanus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Gedrosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sodes: <entryFree id="n44578" type="main" key="so_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōdes</orth> <etym>contr. from si audes, for audies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl>; cf.: dic mihi si audes, quis ea est, etc., Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 960</bibl></etym>; in colloq. lang. (esp. freq. with an <sense id="n44578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">if you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with your leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prithee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pray.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44578.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic sodes mihi, Bellan' videtur specie mulier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dic sodes (mihi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emitte sodes, ne enices fame, sine ire pastum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: mitte ad <pb n="1717" /> <cb n="SOL" /> nos sodes Adelphasium tuam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">da sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi hoc sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i sodes intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tace sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube sodes nummos curari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescere sodes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrige sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodes, dic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:279" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspice, sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:89" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 89</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mane dum sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide etiam sodes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud (vinum) lenius sodes vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut sodes mihi redde decem sestertia, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:103:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 103, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44578.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In other connections: <cit><quote lang="la">at scin' quid, sodes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tene relinquam an rem. Me, sodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam cedo tu sodes, qui occeperas, fabulam remetire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o sodes, quoties tibi loquenti Byzantina sophos dedere regna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 233</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sodii: <entryFree id="n44579" type="main" key="Sodii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sodii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Iberian people in Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 10, 11, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sodoma: <entryFree id="n44580" type="main" key="So^do^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏdŏma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*so/doma</foreign> (Heb. <foreign />), <sense id="n44580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Sodom in Palestine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 2</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏdŏma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 10, 19</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏdŏmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏdŏmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. Sodom. 127</bibl> and 163. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n44580.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏdŏmītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sodomi=tai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sodom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Sodomites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 384</bibl>.—In the <number>sing.</number>, adject.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sodomita libido,</quote> <trans><tr>of Sodom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 42</bibl></cit>; so, cinis, id. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 195.—</sense><sense id="n44580.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏdŏmītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sodom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 5, 16, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 3, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sogdiana: <entryFree id="n44581" type="main" key="Sogdi^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sogdĭāna rĕgĭo</orth>, <sense id="n44581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Asia between the Jaxartes and the Oxus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 1</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sogdĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sogdiana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:24" default="NO">9, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 49</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sugdĭāni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO">3, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sogionti: <entryFree id="n44582" type="main" key="Sogi^onti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sogĭonti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people</hi>, whose name appeared upon a triumphal arch in honor of Augustus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sol: <entryFree id="n44583" type="main" key="so_l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōl</orth>, <itype>sōlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. svar, shine; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*sei/rios, sei/r, se/las, *(ele/nh</foreign>; and Lat. serenus</etym>. <sense id="n44583.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sun</hi>, as a heavenly body. </sense><sense id="n44583.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora duorum generum sunt, unum annale, quod sol circuitu suo finit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis cursus lunaeque meatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum ad cursum solis accommodavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidi fons luminis aetherius sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potest esse sole majus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud dubium esse nulli potest quin arcus imago solis sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n44583.3" n="1" level="3"> Sol oriens or solis ortus, <hi rend="ital">the east</hi>, as a quarter of the heavens: <cit><quote lang="la">spectant in septemtrionem et orientem solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 69</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a sole exoriente supra Maeotis paludes, Cic. poët. Tusc. 5, 17, 49: si illud signum solis ortum conspiceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facem stellae ab ortu solis ad occidentem porrigi visam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ortu solis flare venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 27, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.4" n="2" level="3"> Sol occidens or solis occasus, <hi rend="ital">the west</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum (litus) vergit ad solem occidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborant ut spectent sua triclinaria ad solem occidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectat inter occasum solis et septemtriones,</quote> <trans><tr>north-west</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pars insulae) est propius solis occasum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—Cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub sole cadente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 791</bibl></cit>.—In phrases, sol is often omitted by ellipsis: unde sol oritur oriens nuncupatur aut ortus; <cit><quote lang="la">quo demergitur occidens vel occasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; v. orior, ortus, occĭdo.—</sense><sense id="n44583.5" n="3" level="3"> Sol oriens or sol (solis) ortus=<hi rend="ital">sunrise;</hi> sol occidens or solis (sol) occasus = <hi rend="ital">sunset</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solem nec occidentem umquam viderint, nec orientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole orto Gracchus copias educit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius orto Sole,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi solis lunaeque et ortus et occasus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ab orto sole ad occidentem ... a curiā abscessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, equis insidentes, solis ortu cursum in quemdam locum dirigerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis occasu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad (sub) solis occasum,</quote> <trans><tr>towards sunset</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in occasum declivi sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgente a sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—For sol occasus, v. occidere, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 87</bibl> (ante solem occasum);<cb n="SOL" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 35</bibl> (ad solem occasum); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exortu ad occasum perstare contuentis solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.6" n="4" level="3"> To designate <hi rend="ital">a clime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, etc., as eastern or southern (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille Liberi currus triumphantem usque ad Thebas a solis ortu vehat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terminos civitatis nostrae cum sole metimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ot. Sap. 4</bibl></cit> (31), 1. it tamen ultra oceanum solemque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub alio sole,</quote> <trans><tr>in another clime</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 171</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sua orientis occidentisque terminis finiat (sc. solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.7" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a great good or a great man: <cit><quote lang="la">sol excidisse mihi e mundo videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem e mundo tollere videntur qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Africanus, sol alter (with sole geminato),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mundum posse duobus solibus regi, neque orbem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.8" n="6" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">et sceleratis sol oritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solem suum oriri facit super bonos et malos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 45</bibl></cit>: nondum omnium dierum sol occidit (Germ. <hi rend="ital">Es ist noch nicht aller Tage Abend</hi>) = <hi rend="ital">there are more days yet to come</hi>, sc. <hi rend="ital">when the tables may be turned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.9" n="C" level="2"> The poets reckon time in many ways by the movement, etc., of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">bis me sol adiit gelidae post frigora brumae,</quote> <trans><tr>two years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec sol annuus omnes conficeret metas,</quote> <trans><tr>within a year</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 455</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavo lumine solis,</quote> <trans><tr>on the eighth day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol septimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol Herculei terga leonis adit,</quote> <trans><tr>in midsummer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: O sol Pulcher, O laudande (= dies; <cit><quote lang="la">sc. Augusti reditus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremo sole,</quote> <trans><tr>at noon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub medium solem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 651</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 593</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol abit,</quote> <trans><tr>it is growing late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a primo ad ultimum solem,</quote> <trans><tr>all day long</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.10" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunlight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunshine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat of the sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager soli ostentus,</quote> <trans><tr>exposed to the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta imponito quae frigus defendant et solem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48</bibl></cit> (49): <cit><quote lang="la">uvas ponite in sole biduum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 112</bibl></cit> (113): <cit><quote lang="la">sol semper hic est a mani ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin exta inspicere in sole etiam vivo licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec res posse in sole videri, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quidem paululum a sole,</quote> <trans><tr>out of the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in sole ambulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apricatio in illo Lucretino tuo sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter in calescente sole factum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 36 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrente meridiano sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vehementi sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urente assiduo sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veniens dextrum latus aspiciat sol,</quote> <trans><tr>light of the morning sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reformidant insuetum lumina solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et solem lumina aegra formidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversi solis ab ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>sunstroke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera (spelunca) solem non recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 55, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole correptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces, quos sole torreant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccatur in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agmine (Caesar) anteibat capite detecto, seu sol seu imber esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiens pulveris atque solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.— And trop.: in solem ac pulverem procedere, or producere, <hi rend="ital">into heat and dust</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">into practical life</hi> (opp. umbra eruditorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 6, 14</bibl>.—In a similar sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cedat stilus gladio, umbra soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">clarior quam solis radii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole ipso est clarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, n. 47; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the class. luce clarius, and: cum id solis luce videatur clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44583.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44583.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Suns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">images of the sun</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque pauci neque leves sunt qui se duo soles vidisse dicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albae duos soles visos ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rursus plures soles simul cernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 31, 31, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid eas vocem? imagines solis? Historici soles vocant, et binos ternosque adparuisse memoriae tradunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> = <hi rend="ital">days</hi> (v. I. C.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen illis solibus ulla comparebat avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ego longos Cantando puerum memini me condere soles,</quote> <trans><tr>to spend the long summer days in singing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres soles ... Erramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 203</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:554" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 554</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bajani soles,</quote> <trans><tr>the sunny days of Bajœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:43:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O soles!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:51:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 51, 6</bibl></cit>: soles fulsere <cb n="SOL" /> quondam tibi candidi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles occidere et redire possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis solibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:460" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solibus arctis,</quote> <trans><tr>short winter days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>.—So, to describe certain seasons: <cit><quote lang="la">solibus hibernis ... gratior,</quote> <trans><tr>than the sun in winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si numeres anno soles et nubila toto,</quote> <trans><tr>the sunny and cloudy days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Light</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heat of the sun</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">D. supra): pars terrai perusta solibus assiduis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 253</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviis et solibus icta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae carent ventis et solibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are buried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et soles melius nitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex imbri soles Prospicere ... poteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque novos soles audent se gramina tuto Credere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 332</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:404" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:363" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 363</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 421</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 831</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum blandi soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:157" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore soles juvant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 405</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:42" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus et frater ... Solibus et campo corpora nuda dabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:366" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora semper solibus orba tument,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solibus rupta glacies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminā pereunt caligine soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:154" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivos quo decipis aere soles?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacent exhausti solibus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:2:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:12:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14:4" default="NO">8, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:28" default="NO">14, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura soles assiduo quaerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpeti soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evitatis solibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sal) siccatur aestivis solibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merguntur in aquam solibus tepefactam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec campi minus soles accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarculatio novos soles admittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 184</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 7, 14, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea pellebant tepidos umbracula soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:311" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum patula defendimus arbore soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely of the sun's revolution, without reference to light or heat: <cit><quote lang="la">quae via soles praecipitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:362" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 362</bibl></cit>.—In class. prose sometimes solis ardores, with the force of the <usg type="style">poet.</usg> soles: <cit><quote lang="la">et nimios solis defendit ardores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propter nimios solis ardores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44583.15" n="III" level="1"> Sol, <hi rend="ital">the Sun-god.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44583.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44583.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The ancient Italian deity Sol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represented as driving the four-horse sun-chariot from east to west; later identified with the Greek Helios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and hence often called Titan or Phœbus by the poets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signi dic quid est? Cum quadrigis Sol exoriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sol ... aeternam suscepit lampada mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapax vis Solis equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod magni filia Solis eram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 276</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 346</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solis currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum (invocabis) Solem et Lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grates tibi ago, summe Sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sol Phaëthonti filio facturum se esse dixit quidquid optasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid? illum filium Solis nonne patris ipsius luce indignum putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Solem aurigando aequiperare existimaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solis colossus Rhodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:63" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 19, § 63</bibl>.—Comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">credo edepol equidem dormire Solem atque adpotum probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Phœnician sun-god Heliogabalus</hi> (Elagabal), <hi rend="ital">whose worship was introduced by the later emperors</hi> (Aurelianus, Heliogabalus): <cit><quote lang="la">ad templum Heliogabali tetendit ... et Romae Soli templum posuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl>; 14; 35; 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>; afterwards called Sol Invictus, whose birthday, acc. to the Calendar. Const., was celebrated December 25th; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Julian.</author> Or. 4, p. 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.19" n="c" level="4"> Of <hi rend="ital">the sun-worship of other nations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Germani) deorum numero ducunt Solem et Vulcanum et Lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rex regum, frater Solis et Lunae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the king of Persia</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.20" n="B" level="2"> The sun-god as emblem of omniscience: <cit><quote lang="la">non potuit reperire, si ipsi Soli quaerundas dares, lepidiores ad hanc rem quam ego dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliorem neque tu reperis, neque Sol videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at vigiles mundi ... Sol et Luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc uno quicquam Sol vidisset iniquius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O Solem ipsum beatissimum, qui antequam se abderet fugientem vidit Antonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solem consule, qui late facta diurna videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:582" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Solem fallere possit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 573</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 595" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 595</bibl>.—Hence represented as betrayer of conspiracies: propiusque honos <pb n="1718" /> <cb n="SOLA" /> Boli, qui occulta conjurationis retexisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to him was commended the detection of murderers, in inscriptions over the slain: SOL, TIBI COMMENDO QVI MANVS INTVLIT EI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SOL, TV INDICES EIVS MORTEM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4792</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.21" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, to describe the times of the day: solverat flagrantes Sol pronus equos, = <hi rend="ital">it was night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:408" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 408</bibl>: Sol operum medius summo librabat Olympo Lucentes, ceu staret, equos, = <hi rend="ital">it was mid-day</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 85</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n44583.22" n="IV" level="1"> In gen., solis as an appellation. </sense><sense id="n44583.23" n="A" level="2"> DIES SOLIS, <hi rend="ital">Sunday</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 508</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.24" n="B" level="2"> Solis gemma, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.25" n="C" level="2"> Solis insula, <hi rend="ital">off the coast of Gedrosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 23, 26, § 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.26" n="D" level="2"> Solis fons, <hi rend="ital">in Marmorica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 22</bibl>; Mela, 1, 8, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.27" n="E" level="2"> Solis promunturium, <hi rend="ital">in Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44583.28" n="F" level="1"> Solis oppidum, <hi rend="ital">a town in Ægina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solaciolum: <entryFree id="n44584" type="main" key="so_la_ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlācĭŏlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlāt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>solacium</etym>, <sense id="n44584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little comfort</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solacium: <entryFree id="n44585" type="main" key="so_la_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlācĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlāt-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>solor</etym>, <sense id="n44585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuaging; a comfort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solace</hi> (class.; used equally in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">et vigilantibus hinc aderant solacia somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulcent animos solacia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt solacia, haec fomenta summorum dolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblectamenta et solacia servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium ac solacium praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere solacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:117" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id solacio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacare culpā magnum est solacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipse consolor et maxime illo solacio, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui solacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 16</bibl></cit> (corresp. to consolari): uti solacio, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosque malo solacio, sed non nullo tamen, consolamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui solacia dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum afferret mihi aetas ipsa solacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdae adhibere menti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 132</bibl></cit>; 11, 329; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sibi solacii proponebant, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus luctus nullo solacio levari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacia luctus Exigua ingentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium solacium suae morti invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afficere aliquem solacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulos sacerdotiis in solacium recolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineri atque ossibus alicujus solacium reportare,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>an atonement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulo solacia posco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos et liberos Germanici et nos parentes justis solaciis afficite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 91</bibl>;
