<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:469" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 469</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:596" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 596</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacium annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 39</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: aves, solacia ruris, <hi rend="ital">consolers</hi> (because they cheer the laborers with their singing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:441" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 441</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(musae) solacia frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta, duri solacia casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 377</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44585.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a compensation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indemnification</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacium pro aliquā re alicui praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacium certum ei constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
solago: <entryFree id="n44586" type="main" key="so_la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sol</etym>, <sense id="n44586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> heliotropium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl> and 63.</sense></entryFree>
solamen: <entryFree id="n44587" type="main" key="so_la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype> <etym>solor</etym>, <sense id="n44587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comfort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the class. solacium): <cit><quote lang="la">solamen mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 661</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 493</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 859</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:319" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 319</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:443" default="NO">4, 443</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 539" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 539</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1090" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 1090</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solamentum: <entryFree id="n44588" type="main" key="so_la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solanum: <entryFree id="n44589" type="main" key="so_la_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> strychnos, <hi rend="ital">nightshade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 108, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solanus: <entryFree id="n44590" type="main" key="So_la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (sc. ventus), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sol</etym>, <sense id="n44590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the east wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; usually called Subsolanus, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
solaris: <entryFree id="n44591" type="main" key="so_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sun</hi>-, <hi rend="ital">solar</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus solares lunaresque sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars piceae,</quote> <trans><tr>sunny</tr>, <tr>towards the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: herba, i.e. <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> heliotropium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solarium: <entryFree id="n44592" type="main" key="so_la_ri^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44592.0" n="I" level="1"> (Sc. horologium, which is expressed in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60</bibl>, <cb n="SOLE" /> 60, § 213.) <hi rend="ital">A sundial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solarium dictum id, in quo horae in sole inspiciebantur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 4</bibl></cit> Müll.: ut illum Di perdant, primus qui horas repperit, Quique adeo primus statuit hic solarium, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 301 sq. (2d ed.): venter erat solarium, Aquil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44592.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44592.2" n="1" level="3"> Ad solarium, <hi rend="ital">a much-frequented place in the Forum where the sundial stood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44592.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A clock</hi> in gen. (even <hi rend="ital">a water-clock</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum solarium aut descriptum aut ex aquā contemplere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44592.4" n="II" level="1"> A part of the house exposed to the sun, <hi rend="ital">a flat house-top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a terrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balcony</hi>, or the like, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 25</bibl>; Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jos. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4240</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 3 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 200 sq. (2d ed.).—Also on sepulchral monuments,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4536</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44593" type="main" key="so^la_rium2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlārium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (sc. vectigal), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>solum</etym>, <sense id="n44593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ground-rent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:7:section=2" default="NO">7, 1, 7, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:17" default="NO">13, 7, 17</bibl>; 30, 1, 39, § 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 39</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 121, n. 614.</sense></entryFree>
solarius: <entryFree id="n44594" type="main" key="so_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 1. solarium <sense id="n44594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solatiolum: <entryFree id="n44595" type="main" key="so_la_ti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlātĭŏlum</orth>, v. solaciolum.</entryFree>
solatium: <entryFree id="n44596" type="main" key="so_la_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlātĭum</orth>, v. solacium.</entryFree>
solator: <entryFree id="n44597" type="main" key="so_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>solor</etym>, <sense id="n44597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comforter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consoler</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ego solator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis lugentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solatus: <entryFree id="n44598" type="main" key="so_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sol</etym>, <sense id="n44598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sunburned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunstruck; subst. masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solatis, id est sole correptis, prosunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: solatum, genus morbi maxime a rusticantibus dicitur, cujus meminit etiam Afranius, <hi rend="ital">a sunstroke</hi>, Fest. pp. 300 and 301 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
soldurii: <entryFree id="n44599" type="foreign" key="soldu_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">soldūrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n44599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">retainers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vassals</hi> of a chieftain: <cit><quote lang="la">devoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soldus: <entryFree id="n44600" type="main" key="soldus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">soldus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. solidus <sense id="n44600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solea: <entryFree id="n44601" type="main" key="so^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>solum</etym>. <sense id="n44601.0" n="I" level="1"> A slipper consisting of <hi rend="ital">a sole</hi> fastened on by a strap across the instep, <hi rend="ital">a sandal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ferme id genus, quibus plantarum calces tantum infimae teguntur, cetera prope nuda et teretibus habenis vincta sunt, soleas dixerunt, nonnumquam voce Graecā crepidulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 5</bibl></cit> (worn by men in the house only: considered as a mark of effeminacy if worn out of doors): NEIVE QVIS IN POPLICO LVCI PRAETEXTAM NEIVE SOLEAS HABETO, Lex in Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 569; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 128</bibl>; and v. soleatus: ut vendat soleam dimidiatam, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29</bibl> (3, 27), 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 14, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:169" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:612" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 612</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:65:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 65, 1</bibl>.—These sandals were taken off on reclining at table, and resumed after the meal: <cit><quote lang="la">deme soleas: cedo, bibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo soleas mihi: auferte mensam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere soleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:50:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscere soleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soleas festinare,</quote> <trans><tr>to put on in haste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 105</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 130 sq.—</sense><sense id="n44601.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a like shape. </sense><sense id="n44601.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fetter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44601.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of shoe</hi> for animals (not nailed on, like our horseshoes, which were unknown to the ancients, but drawn on and taken off again when not needed), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl> and 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 140</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n44601.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of oil-press</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44601.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sole</hi>: Pleuronectes solea, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:124" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:102" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 32, § 102</bibl>.—In a lusus verbb. with signif. I., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 59</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44601.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sill</hi>: solea, ut ait Verrius, est non solum ea, quae solo pedis subicitur sed etiam pro materiā robusteā, super quam paries craticius exstruitur, Fest. pp. 300 and 301 Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n44601.7" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sole of the foot</hi> of animals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 56, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solearis: <entryFree id="n44602" type="hapax" key="so^le^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĕāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solea</etym>, <sense id="n44602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a sole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sandal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sandal-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Car. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solearius: <entryFree id="n44603" type="main" key="so^le^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sandal-maker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4085</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soleatus: <entryFree id="n44604" type="main" key="so^le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing sandals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having sandals on</hi> (if of a man and in public, a mark of effeminacy; v. solea): stetit soleatus praetor populi Romani cum <cb n="SOLE" /> pallio purpureo tunicāque talari, mulierculā nixus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl>; Castric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 1</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 207, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:83:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 83, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solemnis: <entryFree id="n44605" type="main" key="so_lemnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlemnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlennis</orth>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlemnĭtas</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlemnĭtus</orth>, v. sollenn-.</entryFree>
solen: <entryFree id="n44606" type="greek" key="so_le_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlēn</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">swlh/n</foreign>, <sense id="n44606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of seamussel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the razor-fish</hi>: Solen, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:192" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 69, 88, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:139" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 52, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solennis: <entryFree id="n44607" type="main" key="so_lennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlennis, sōlennĭtas, sōlennĭ-tus</orth>, v. sollenn-.</entryFree>
soleo: <entryFree id="n44608" type="main" key="so^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype> (<sense id="n44608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> solinunt, for solent, acc. to Fest. s. v. nequinunt, p. 162 Müll.; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> solui, Cato and Enn. acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L.L. 9:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.L. 9, § 107</bibl>: soluerint, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 2</bibl>: soluerat, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 872</bibl> P.; or H. 2, 55 Dietsch; no <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 591; 609), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. suesco</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44608.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be accustomed</hi> (cf. assuesco). </sense><sense id="n44608.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (so most freq.); <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mentiri solet, pejerare consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruri crebro esse soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ego in occulto agere soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (servi) solent esse eris utibiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 23</bibl>: nam vi depugnare sues stolidi soliti sunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 109 Vahl.): quaerunt in scirpo, soliti quod dicere, nodum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> Müll. (Sat. v. 46 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui (paterā) Pterela potitare rex solitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (consuetudine) solitus sum uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soliti prandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cum Thucydides), id quod optimo cuique Athenis accidere solitum est, in exsilium pulsus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">often solitus eram = solebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:1:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 1, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44608.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore operā ibi serviles nuptiae, quam liberales etiam, curari solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum illud verbum est, vulgo quod dici solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde videri Danaum solitae naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec illa dici solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permirum mihi videri solet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (domus) alio domino solita est frequentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod spernerentur ab iis a quibus essent coli soliti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut solet fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:7" default="NO">4, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fieri solet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44608.4" n="(g)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave tu idem faxis, alii quod servi solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me dico ire, quo saturi solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artior, quam solebat, somnus complexus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Nugas garris. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Soleo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ego soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem pacto ut comici servi solent, Coniciam in collum pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo jam, ut solet, Jurgabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, ut soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut solitus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum audissem Antiochum, ut solebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plerumque in atroci negotio solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod prava ambitio solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 96, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut solebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quaedam in collibus, ut solet, controversia pastorum esset orta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 24</bibl>.—So often with Plautus in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.: Di.</hi> Mala femina es. <hi rend="ital">As.</hi> Solens sum: <cit><quote lang="la">ea est disciplina,</quote> <trans><tr>that's my way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubens fecero et solens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego abscessi solens Paulum ab illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44608.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to have intercourse</hi> with, in mal. part. (rare): viris cum suis praedicant nos solere; <cit><quote lang="la">Suas pellices esse aiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:113:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 113, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in a passive sense (which one is used to, or which usually happens), <hi rend="ital">wonted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.; not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. consuetus); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solito membra levare toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad solitum rusticus ibit opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:168" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctantibus solita insolitaque alimenta deerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertia Germanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamenta Liburnicis solita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what is usual</hi>: hostibus gratiam habendam,<pb n="1719" /> <cb n="SOLI" />  quod solitum quicquam liberae civitatis fieret (opp. res desueta), <hi rend="ital">a usual thing in a free state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde tona eloquio, solitum tibi!</quote> <trans><tr>according to your custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 64, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentum neces aliaque solita regibus ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: praeter solita vitiosis magistratibus, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 314, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando aliquid ex solito variaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quā praeter solitum dulcedine laeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 412</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praeter solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:36:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 36, 1</bibl></cit>; and esp. freq. with a comparative in the <hi rend="ital">abl. comp.</hi> solito: <cit><quote lang="la">solito formosior Aesone natus,</quote> <trans><tr>more than usually handsome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 84</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">solito uberior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:547" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solers: <entryFree id="n44609" type="main" key="so_lers"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlers</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlerter</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlertĭa</orth>, v. sollers, etc.</entryFree>
soletum: <entryFree id="n44610" type="main" key="Soletum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Soletum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Calabria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soli: <entryFree id="n44611" type="main" key="So^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏli</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Soloe</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*so/loi</foreign>. <sense id="n44611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Pompeiopolis, now <hi rend="ital">Mezetli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 56, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏleus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*soleu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Soli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Cyprus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Solia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl> (Jan. Soloe).</sense></entryFree>
soliar: <entryFree id="n44612" type="main" key="so^li^ar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>solium</etym>, <sense id="n44612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the feet</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 3, 25</bibl>; Fest. s. v. solla, pp. 298 and 299 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
solicanus: <entryFree id="n44613" type="hapax" key="so_li^ca^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭcănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solus-cano</etym>, <sense id="n44613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">singing alone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solicatio: <entryFree id="n44614" type="main" key="so_li^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sol</etym>, <sense id="n44614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sunning</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(li/wsis</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solicitatio: <entryFree id="n44615" type="main" key="so_li^ci^ta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭcĭtātio, sōlĭcĭto</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭcĭtus</orth>, etc., v. soll-.</entryFree>
solidamen: <entryFree id="n44616" type="main" key="so^li^da_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>solido</etym>, <sense id="n44616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which makes firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a strengthener</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Carm. 6, 2, 115.</sense></entryFree>
solidamentum: <entryFree id="n44617" type="main" key="so^li^da_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which makes firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a strengthener</hi> (late Lat.): corporis (ossa), Lact. Opif. Dei, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solidatio: <entryFree id="n44618" type="main" key="so^li^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid; a fastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solidatrix: <entryFree id="n44619" type="hapax" key="so^li^da_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>solidator</etym>, <sense id="n44619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that makes firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a strengthener</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solide: <entryFree id="n44620" type="main" key="so^li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. solidus <sense id="n44620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
solidesco: <entryFree id="n44621" type="main" key="so^li^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n44621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [solidus], <hi rend="ital">to become firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi> (post - Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">moles sub aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupta cartilago,</quote> <trans><tr>to unite</tr>, <tr>grow together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 87, § 216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solidipes: <entryFree id="n44622" type="main" key="so^li^di^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>; <sense id="n44622.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">of animals whose feet are not cloven,</quote> <trans><tr>solid-footed</tr>, <tr>whole-hoofed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 65, 84, § 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 73, 93, § 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:128" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soliditas: <entryFree id="n44623" type="main" key="so^li^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44623.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">solidness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solidity</hi> (good prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44623.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n44623.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Thickness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 17, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44623.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Solidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 8</bibl>.— Hence, <number>plur.</number> concr.: soliditates, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid masses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44623.4" n="C" level="2"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirety</hi> (opp. a share, part): <cit><quote lang="la">possessionis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 52, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 288</bibl> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas universorum soliditas singulorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 14, 41.</sense></entryFree>
solido: <entryFree id="n44624" type="main" key="so^li^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">solid; to make whole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound; to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten together</hi> (not ante-Aug., and for the most part only in the <hi rend="ital">pass.;</hi> cf.: compono, reficio, stabilio). </sense><sense id="n44624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(area) cretā solidanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus fistucationibus solidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra aëre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia sine trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa fracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 65, § 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (nervi) incisi solidantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:152" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 16, 95, § 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cartilago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulae stanno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 160</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies solidata veneno,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>against decay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 691</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44624.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44624.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem Romanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 33:11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 33, 11</bibl></cit>: imperium Romanum ex diuturnā convulsione solidatum, Auct. Pan. ad Const. 1: illud <cb n="SOLI" /> etiam constitutione solidamus, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 9, 1.—</sense><sense id="n44624.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro uxorem unius corporis compage,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44624.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To correct</hi>: rationes, Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solidus: <entryFree id="n44625" type="main" key="so^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (contr. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sol-dus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 65</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sarvas, all; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(/los</foreign>, whole; old Lat. sollus; cf. sollistimus</etym>, <sense id="n44625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44625.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: individua et solida corpora (sc. <foreign lang="greek">a)to/moi</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 67, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra solida et globosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columna aurea (opp. extrinsecus inaurata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cornua (opp. cava),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries vel solidus vel fornicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera solida atque plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crateres auro solidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex solido elephanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 552</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum solidum nodis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa auro solida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidum ex auro signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc solida est tellus, quae lacus ante fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:404" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 404</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes (opp. aër),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis ad ferendum incursum maris solida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit solidum quodcumque subest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ed. 16, 12</bibl></cit>: solidus cibus, <hi rend="ital">solid food</hi>, as opposed to fluid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 5, 12</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidior caseus factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidissima materiaï corpora (opp. mollia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 565</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:951" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 951</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 262</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a solid substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duae formae praestantes sint, ex solidis globus, ex planis autem circulus aut orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tangi potest, quod careat solido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (species deorum) nihil concreti habeat, nihil solidi, nihil expressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane abscindere soldo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa fit ad solidum,</quote> <trans><tr>to the solid ground</tr>, <tr>to the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:821" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finditur in solidum cuneis via,</quote> <trans><tr>into the hard wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque fundamenta (amphitheatri) per solidum subdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solido procedebat elephas in pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>on solid ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44625.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (opp. to that which is divided, scattered, or in parts), <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi> (= integer, totus): <cit><quote lang="la">usurā, nec eā solidā, contentus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia semestri solidum stipendium accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida taurorum viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut solidos hauriant (serpentes) cervos taurosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus solida ungula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus terrae quasdam (civitates) solidas absorbuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut decies solidum exsorberet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at once</tr>, <tr>in one draught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 240</bibl></cit>: decem annos solidos errasse, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 405, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem solido demere de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum solidum consulatum explere,</quote> <trans><tr>incomplete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, quibus...solidae suo stant robore vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 639</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44625.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the whole sum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita bona veneant, ut solidum suum cuique solvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:2:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 2, 2 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44625.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus), in the time of the emperors <hi rend="ital">a gold coin</hi>, at first called aureus, and worth about twenty-five denarii, afterwards reduced nearly one half in value, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO">11, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:42" default="NO">21, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 70, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 242, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 29, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Esd. 2, 69; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 29, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44625.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">real</hi> (in this sense a favorite word with Cic.; syn.: firmus, constans, stabilis; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. inanis, levis, vanus, mobilis, etc.): solida et perpetua fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida et robusta et assidua frequentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida atque robusta eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida ac virilis ingenii vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim gloria solida quaedam res et expressa, non adumbrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia solida et expressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod appellant honestum, non tam solido quam splendido nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas austera et solida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida veraque laus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solida laus ac vera dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria (with vera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: nostra gloria, cum sit ex solido,<cb n="SOLI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla utilitas (with puerilis delectatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 576</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <trans><tr>firm</tr>, <tr>determined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidum opus doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">in solidiore aliquo scripti genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior solidiorque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO">5, 4</bibl>, ext. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ex rebus nihil est, quod solidum tenere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos in solido rursus Fortuna locavit,</quote> <trans><tr>in safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 427</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentia bona nondum tota in solido sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra gloria, cum sit ex solido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut salus ejus locetur in solido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n44625.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdum</orth> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">soundly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dinoscere cautus Quid solidum crepet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:25" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus irata solidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44625.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭdē</orth> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n44625.8" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Densely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solide et crassis viminibus contexta cista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solide natus est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without a hollow place</tr>, <tr>without wind in one's inside</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concreta aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44625.9" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, natus necne is fuerit, id solide scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 47</bibl>; Ter And. 5, 5, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ael. Ver. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solifer: <entryFree id="n44626" type="hapax" key="so_li^fe^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭfĕr</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sol-fero</etym>, <sense id="n44626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sun-bringing</hi>, of the east: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 159" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soliferreum: <entryFree id="n44627" type="hapax" key="so_li^ferre^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭferrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. solliferreum.</entryFree>
solifuga: <entryFree id="n44628" type="main" key="so^li^fu_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭfūga</orth>, v. solipuga.</entryFree>
solifundium: <entryFree id="n44629" type="hapax" key="so^li^fundi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭfundĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>solum-fundus</etym>, perh. <sense id="n44629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">landed property</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princ. Hist. Fragm. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princ. Hist. Fragm. 7</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
soligena: <entryFree id="n44630" type="hapax" key="so_li^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>sol-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n44630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a child of the Sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:317" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 317</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
soliloquium: <entryFree id="n44631" type="main" key="so_li^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>solus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n44631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a talking to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a soliloquy</hi>, a word formed by Augustin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Solil. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Solil. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
solino: <entryFree id="n44632" type="gloss" key="solino"><orth extent="full" lang="la">solino</orth> = consulo, acc. to Fest. pp. 350 and 351 Müll. [prob. the lengthened form from solo, the ground form to con-sul and con-sulo; different from solinunt-solent; v. soleo <sense id="n44632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>].</sense></entryFree>
solinus: <entryFree id="n44633" type="main" key="So_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> C. Julius, <sense id="n44633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman writer of the third century of the Christian era</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a work entitled</hi> Polyhistor, <hi rend="ital">mostly taken from Pliny's</hi> Historia Naturalis.</sense></entryFree>
solipuga: <entryFree id="n44634" type="main" key="so^li^pu_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭpūga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of venomous ant</hi> (or, acc. to Solinus, <hi rend="ital">a kind of venomous spider</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 29, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:163" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 81, § 163</bibl>. —Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">solpūga</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 837</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">soli-pugna</orth>, acc. to Fest. pp. 300 and 301 Müll.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭfūga</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4, 3</bibl> and 6; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">salpūga</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 29, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solistimum: <entryFree id="n44635" type="main" key="so_listi^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlistĭmum</orth>, v. sollistimus.</entryFree>
solitaneus: <entryFree id="n44636" type="hapax" key="so^li^ta_ne^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭtānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solitus, from soleo</etym>, <sense id="n44636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>: dolores, Marc. Emp 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44637" type="hapax" key="so_li^ta_ne^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solus</etym>, <sense id="n44637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellum confeci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 3 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
solitanus: <entryFree id="n44638" type="hapax" key="so_li^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sol</etym>, <sense id="n44638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the appellation of a species of African snail</hi>, perh. named from the Promunturium Solis (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 9</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 56, 82, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solitarius: <entryFree id="n44639" type="main" key="so_li^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solus</etym>, <sense id="n44639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lonely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. singularis): natura solitarium nihil amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam solitaria non posset virtus ad ea, quae summa sunt, pervenire, conjuncta et consociata cum alterā perveniret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (natura) non solitaria sit neque simplex, sed cum alio juncta atque conexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus desertus ac solitarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae apes non sunt solitaria natura, ut aquilae, sed ut homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitarius homo atque in agro vitam agens,</quote> <trans><tr>living by himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitaria et velut umbratilis vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitarium aliquod aut rarum judicatum afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:44:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 44, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distentus solitariā cenā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a dinner which he has taken by himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo id egit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>nothing else</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>absolute</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. 13</bibl></cit>: hominem solitarium tres tam validos <pb n="1720" /> <cb n="SOLI" /> evitasse juvenes, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Pleon.: solus ac solitarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solitas: <entryFree id="n44640" type="main" key="so_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>solus</etym>, <sense id="n44640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loneliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitude</hi> (ante- and post-class. for solitudo): tuam solitatem memorans, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 173, 28</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 153 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 288, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
solitatim: <entryFree id="n44641" type="hapax" key="so_li^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>solitas</etym>, <sense id="n44641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">solitarily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Eloqu. p. 235" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Eloqu. p. 235</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
solitaurilia: <entryFree id="n44642" type="main" key="so_li^tauri_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtaurīlĭa</orth>, v. suovetaurilia.</entryFree>
solito: <entryFree id="n44643" type="hapax" key="so^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [soleo], <hi rend="ital">to be much accustomed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wont</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem Africanum solitavisse in Capitolium ventitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
solitudo: <entryFree id="n44644" type="main" key="so_li^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>solus</etym>, <sense id="n44644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being alone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loneliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitude</hi> (of a person or place); <hi rend="ital">a lonely place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wilderness</hi> (class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf.: secretum, secessus). </sense><sense id="n44644.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ampla domus dedecori saepe domino fit, si est in eā solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquis nos deus ex hac hominum frequentiā tolleret et in solitudine uspiam collocaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>; so (opp. frequentia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. celebritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audistis, quae solitudo in agris esset, quae vastitas, quae fuga aratorum, quam deserta, quam relicta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 114</bibl></cit>;
