cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque venis, fuga est et ingens Circa te solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:44:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo ante ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi postquam solitudinem intellexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ab oratoribus quaedam in foro solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:227" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 63, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero hic non contemptus est a tyrannis atque ejus solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi solitudo et recessus provincia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquā desertissimā solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sigambri se in solitudinem ac silvas abdiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: an malitis hanc solitudinem vestram quam urbem hostium esse? <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert place</hi> (Rome), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delere omne Latium, vastas inde solitudines facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam ex solitudine suā prodeuntem, nisi ut solitudinem faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi solitudinem faciunt, pacem appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:24" default="NO">9, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivosae solitudini cohaerentes,</quote> <trans><tr>bordering on</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 64</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac omnis humani cultūs solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:19:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 19, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudines renuntiavere missi milites ad explorandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 14, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 20, § 53</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44644.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., analog. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)rhmi/a</foreign>, in respect of something wanting, <hi rend="ital">a being left alone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state of want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprivation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hujus (orbae) solitudinem Te obtestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum ac parentum solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesenniae viduitas ac solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo atque inopia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messalina tribus omnino comitantibus (id repente solitudinis erat) spatium urbis pedibus emensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
solitus: <entryFree id="n44645" type="main" key="so^li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from soleo.</entryFree>
solium: <entryFree id="n44646" type="main" key="so^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from the root sol, kindr. with sed, sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n44646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44646.1" n="I" level="1"> Most usu. of gods, kings, or other distinguished personages. </sense><sense id="n44646.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chair of state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throne</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thronus, tribunal): regali in solio sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus regia et in domo regale solium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solio rex infit ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio tum Juppiter aureo Surgit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 116</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum solia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regale (Jovis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:353" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens in solio consulantibus respondere (of solicitors),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedet Sollemni solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburnum, i. e. sella curulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons Hon. 588</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44646.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> like our <hi rend="ital">throne</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pristina majestas soliorum et sceptra superba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1137</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solio sceptroque potitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:309" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:742" default="NO">6, 742</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio avorum aliquem depellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 690</bibl></cit>; Claud. IV. <cb n="SOLL" /> Cons. Hon. 213: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrium in paterno solio locaturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pacorum avito Arsacidarum solio depulsuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternum solium per vim, per arma capere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44646.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tub</hi>, esp. for bathing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 800</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 1</bibl>.—For other purposes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 8, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44646.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stone coffin</hi> for persons of distinction, <hi rend="ital">a sarcophagus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solium Porphyretici marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 343 al.</sense></entryFree>
solivagus: <entryFree id="n44647" type="main" key="so_li^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>solus - vagor</etym> (Ciceron.). <sense id="n44647.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roving alone;</hi> of animals that lead a solitary life: <cit><quote lang="la">earum (bestiarum) partim solivagas, partim congregatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">non est enim singulare nec solivagum genus hoc (hominum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 25, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(elephanti) minume ex omnibus solivagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>; v. solitarius.—</sense><sense id="n44647.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">caelo solivago et volubili et in orbem incitato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solivaga, cognitio et jejuna,</quote> <trans><tr>contracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitas,</quote> <trans><tr>standing alone</tr>, <tr>incomparable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sollemnis: <entryFree id="n44648" type="main" key="sollemnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollemnis</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlemnis, sollennis, sōlennis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sollempnis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sollus, i. e. totus-annus</etym>, prop. that takes place every year; in relig. lang. of solemnities, <sense id="n44648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annual;</hi> hence, in gen., </sense><sense id="n44648.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemne, quod omnibus annis praestari debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=298" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 298</bibl></cit> Müll. (cf. anniversarius): <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia sacra dicuntur, quae certis temporibus annisque fleri solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 344</bibl></cit> ib.: sacra stata, sollemnia, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. stata, p. 344 ib.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad sollemne et statum sacrificium curru vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit> (v. <itype>sisto</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies festi atque sollemnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Aequis statum jam ac prope sollemne in singulos annos bellum timebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus Maiae sollemnes ineundis magistratibus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnis dapes Libare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerimoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, according as the idea of the <hi rend="ital">religious</hi> or that of the <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stated</hi> nature of the thing qualified predominates. </sense><sense id="n44648.3" n="A" level="2"> With the idea of its religious character predominating, <hi rend="ital">religious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipiendaque curarit sollemnia sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemni more sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad flaminem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precatio comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sollemnibus verbis dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:47:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti in sollemnibus sacris fleri consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia vota Reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre sollemnia dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnis ducere pompas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnis mactare ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies jure sollemnis mihi, sanctiorque natali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemni voce movere preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:622" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:13:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festum sollemne parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnes ludos celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:597" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum esse officium tam sanctum atque sollemne, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies baptismo sollemnior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">die tibi sollemnissimo natali meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44648.4" n="b" level="4"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sollemne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a religious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solemn rite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceremony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemn games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemnity</hi>, etc. (so perh. not in Cic.); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter publicum sollemne sponsalibus rite factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemne clavi figendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli Fidei sollemne instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemne allatum ex Arcadiā,</quote> <trans><tr>festal games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudio funeris sollemne perinde ac divo Augusto celebratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <number>plur.</number> infra: <cit><quote lang="la">per sollemne nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. infra.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia (Isidis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus sacri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinquatruum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulo sollemnia mittent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 605</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8</bibl>, <cb n="SOLL" /> 208; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:259" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44648.5" n="B" level="2"> With the idea of stated, regular character predominant, <hi rend="ital">wonted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi> (syn.: consuetus, solitus; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. only after the Aug. period): prope sollemnis militum lascivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socer arma Latinus habeto, Imperium sollemne socer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:174" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus bigarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis sollemne viris opus (venatio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi sollemnis debetur gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficit sollemnem numerum (testium) exaudire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viā sollemni egressi,</quote> <trans><tr>the public way</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae dulce diu fuit et sollemne, reclusa Mane domo vigilare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectari sollemne olim erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua complere sollemnia,</quote> <trans><tr>tribute</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sol-lemne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum illud sollemne servemus, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>usual custom</tr>, <tr>practice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae nuptae intrantes etiamnum sollemne habent postes adipe attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 135</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos traditus ab antiquis inter cetera sollemnia manet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proin repeterent sollemnia,</quote> <trans><tr>their customary avocations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum non jure factum dicitur, ubi sollemnia juris defuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>usages</tr>, <tr>customary formalities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutat quadrata rotundis: Insanire putas sollemnia me neque rides,</quote> <trans><tr>in the common way</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sollemnĭter</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sollenn-, sōlemn-</orth>; very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n44648.6" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A. supra.) <hi rend="ital">In a religious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solemn manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemnly</hi>, = rite: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus (sacris) sollemniter peractis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: intermissum convivium sollemniter instituit, <hi rend="ital">with pomp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus, quem sollemniter celebramus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44648.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B. supra.) <hi rend="ital">According to custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the usual</hi> or <hi rend="ital">customary manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(greges elephantorum) se purificantes sollemniter aquā circumspergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere hordeum pullis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo sollemniter inquirente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmisso sollemniter Tigride,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.); <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, II. A. No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
sollemnitas: <entryFree id="n44649" type="main" key="sollemni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollemnĭtas</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sollenn-, solenn-</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">solemn-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sollemnis</etym> (postclass.; cf.: sollemne, celebratio). <sense id="n44649.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A solemnity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebration</hi> of a day: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum variae sollemnitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristina (ludorum Isthmiorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condendi honoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum sollemnitate prisco more completa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 16, 16</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44649.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:8:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:25" default="NO">1, 7, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sollemniter: <entryFree id="n44650" type="main" key="sollemni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollemnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sollemnis <sense id="n44650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sollemnitus: <entryFree id="n44651" type="hapax" key="sollemni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollemnĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sollenn-, sōlenn-, sōlemn-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sollemnis</etym>, <sense id="n44651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">solemnly</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sollers: <entryFree id="n44652" type="main" key="sollers"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollers</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlers</orth>), <itype>tis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> regularly sollerti; <sense id="n44652.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">sollerte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 35</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sollus, i. e. totus - ars, and therefore qs. all art; hence, in gen.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dexterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adroit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi> (class.; syn.; sagax, subtilis, expertus). </sense><sense id="n44652.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quae liberum Scire aequom est adulescentem, solertem dabo,</quote> <trans><tr>to make ready</tr>, <tr>accomplished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: vigilans ac sollers, sicca, sana, sobria sum, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni vel officio vel sermone sollers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor sollers in arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollertem tu me facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:279" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollertior et ingeniosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla, rudis antea et ignarus belli, sollertissimus omnium factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloribus Sollers nunc hominem ponere nunc deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:79" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:260" default="NO">8, 260</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa lyrae sollers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollers cunctandi Fabius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 126</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset deus ad excogitandum providentissimus, ad faciendum sollertissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44652.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera providae sollertisque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: animus,<pb n="1721" /> <cb n="SOLL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sollerti corde Prometheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollerti astu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollers subtilisque descriptio partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum et pecudum custodia sollers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus acuminis in reprehendendis verbis versutum et sollers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:840" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 840</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 8, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sollertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollertius est multo genus virile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1356</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: fundus sollertissimus, qs. <hi rend="ital">most creative</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">most productive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sollerter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlert-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dexterously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagaciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingeniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacere futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulata sollertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimere incessus, vultum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colere hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:624" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 624</bibl></cit>: imperare, Treb. Poll. Gall. 13.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sollertissime perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora persequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Car. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sollertia: <entryFree id="n44653" type="main" key="sollerti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollertĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlert-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sollers</etym>, <sense id="n44653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickness of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dexterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adroitness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expertness</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: acumen, subtilitas, scientia): data est quibusdam bestiis machinatio quaedam atque sollertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla ars imitari sollertiam naturae potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaldaei sollertiā ingeniorum antecellunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est genus (Gallorum) summae sollertiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum adhibita sollertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii sollertia,</quote> <trans><tr>shrewdness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac re tanta inest ratio atque sollertia,</quote> <trans><tr>knowledge and skill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; so (with ratio) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut artis pariat sollertia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni re fugienda est talis sollertia,</quote> <trans><tr>such subtlety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari non modo diligentiam sed enim sollertiam ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tua formosos cepit sollertia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia conando docilis sollertia vicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit sollertia tempore etiam adjuta,</quote> <trans><tr>the ingenious plan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregiis ingeniorum sollertiis ex aevo collocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44653.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(honestum) aut in perspicientiā veri sollertiāque versatur, aut, etc. (shortly after: perspicere et explicare rationem),</quote> <trans><tr>the perception and intelligent development of the true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agendi cogitandique sollertia,</quote> <trans><tr>adroitness</tr>, <tr>quickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:309" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 309</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sollicitatio: <entryFree id="n44654" type="main" key="solli^ci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sollicito</etym>. <sense id="n44654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Vexation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on account of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigation</hi> (good prose): omnium, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Allobrogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitationibus expugnari,</quote> <trans><tr>seductions</tr>, <tr>allurements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitationibus periclitari,</quote> <trans><tr>to find by trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
sollicitator: <entryFree id="n44655" type="main" key="solli^ci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭtātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlic-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tempter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seducer</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">alienarum nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:14" default="NO">11, 3, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:14" default="NO">11, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sollicite: <entryFree id="n44656" type="main" key="solli^ci^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sollicitus <sense id="n44656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sollicito: <entryFree id="n44657" type="main" key="solli^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sollĭcĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭ-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sollicitus</etym>, <sense id="n44657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move; to distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make uneasy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44657.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in lively motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n44657.2" n="A" level="2"> Histri tela manu jacientes sollicitabant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 438 Vahl.): myropolas omnes sollicito; <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque unguentum est, ungor,</quote> <trans><tr>keep them busy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fas esse, quod sit fundatum perpetuo aevo, sollicitare suis .. ex sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnisque repente sollicitant divum nocturno tempore lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1008" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1008</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:965" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 965</bibl>: teneram ferro sollicitavit humum, <hi rend="ital">stirred</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by the plough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 30</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae, Quas tellus, nullo sollicitante (i. e. eam) dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:396" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remis freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum tremoribus orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamina docto Pollice, pregn.,</quote> <trans><tr>excite by handling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 169</bibl></cit> (v. II. B. 1. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum vomitu, alvum purgatione,</quote> <trans><tr>to move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: mox, velut aurā sollicitante, provecti longius, <hi rend="ital">as if a breeze were moving</hi> <cb n="SOLL" /> <hi rend="ital">us on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl>, prooem. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (spiritus naturae), quamdiu non ... pellitur, jacet innoxius ... ubi illum extrinsecus superveniens causa sollicitat, compellitque et in artum agit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>stirs up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitavit aquas remis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus, qui primus anhelis sollicitatur equis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu remige Medo sollicitatur Athos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ruf. 1, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenalias feras,</quote> <trans><tr>to hunt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne salebris sollicitentur apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Danubius non jam radices nec media montium stringit, sed juga ipsa sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 9</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:22:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:46:4" default="NO">11, 46, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 20, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To produce by stirring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw out</hi> (rare): radices in ipsā arbore sollicitando, <hi rend="ital">by starting roots from the tree</hi> (cf. the context), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 13, 21, § 98</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitatur id in nobis quod diximus ante semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1037" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1037</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, = sollicitum facere. </sense><sense id="n44657.5" n="A" level="2"> With the notion of distress, <hi rend="ital">to cause distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneasiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44657.6" n="1" level="3"> Of the body (very rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mala copia Aegrum sollicitat stomachum,</quote> <trans><tr>distresses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44657.7" n="2" level="3"> Of the mind; constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">animum</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n44657.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To fill with apprehension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspense of the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and anxiety for the future;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, = sollicitum esse, <hi rend="ital">to be distressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to torment one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ibo ut visam, estne id aurum ut condidi, quod me sollicitat miserum plurimis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: certo scio, non ut Flamininum sollicitari te, Tite, sic noctesque diesque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum equidem sentio, suspicio quae te sollicitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicine me atque illam operā tuā nunc miseros sollicitarier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: egon' id timeo? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quid te ergo aliud sollicitat? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 82</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut quid sit id quod sollicitere ad hunc modum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me autem jam et mare istuc et terra sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an dubitas quin ea me cura (pro genero et filio) vehementissime sollicitet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa sunt quae me sollicitant anguntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cujus metu sollicitaret animos sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Scipionem exspectatio successoris sollicitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderantem quod satis est neque Tumultuosum sollicitat mare, Nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:54:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 54, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de posteris nostris et de illā immortalitate rei publicae sollicitor, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:29:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 29, 41</bibl></cit>.— Hence, like verbs of fearing, with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (<hi rend="ital">lest</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">et Quibus nunc sollicitor rebus! ne aut ille alserit, Aut uspiam ceciderit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitari se simulans, ne in ejus perniciem conspirarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, like verbs of emotion: <cit><quote lang="la">me illa cura sollicitat angitque vehementer, quod ... nihil a te, nihil ex istis locis ... affluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.9" n="(b)" level="5"> More rarely, <hi rend="ital">to grieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make wretched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc facinus quod tuom sollicitat animum, id ego feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed erile scelus me sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: cur meam senectutem hujus sollicito amentiā? <hi rend="ital">why do I make my old age miserable by</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cura (ob miserum statum rei publicae) sollicitat et hunc meum socium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me magis sollicitat quam ... non me ridere tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To disturb the rest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repose</hi> of a person or community, <hi rend="ital">to trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, = perturbare: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me quaeris? quid laboras? quid hunc sollicitas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quae roget, ne se sollicitare velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas et libido et ignavia semper animum excruciant, et semper sollicitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxitudo, prona ad luctum et maerens, semperque ipsa se sollicitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:Fragm. 2:41:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. Fragm. 2, 41, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam rebellando saepius nos sollicitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finitimi populi, qui castra, non urbem positam in medio ad sollicitandam omnium pacem crediderant,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb the peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde neque ille sollicitare quietae civitatis statum possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira Jovis sollicitati prava religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea cura quietos (deos) sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium ambitio numquam quieta sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Polyb. 4</bibl></cit> (23), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">eum non metus sollicitabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit> (28), 4: (voluptas)<cb n="SOLL" />  licet alia ex aliis admoveat, quibus totos partesque nostri sollicitet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et magnum bello sollicitare Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitatque feros non aequis viribus hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me nutricibus, me aviae educanti, me omnibus qui sollicitare illas aetates solent, praeferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 8: sollicitare manes, <hi rend="ital">to disturb the dead by mentioning their names</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce, precor, manes sollicitare meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ad mentionem defunctorum testamur, memoriam eorum a nobis non sollicitari?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicito manes,</quote> <trans><tr>I disturb the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitare umbras = ciere, citare, in necromancy,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.11" n="B" level="2"> Without the idea of distress or uneasiness. </sense><sense id="n44657.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">unicus est de quo sollicitamur honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:10:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 10, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitatque deas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanis maritum sollicitat precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:683" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoque Musarum studium a nocte silenti Sollicitare solet, Claud. VI. Cons. Hon. praef. 12: cupidinem lentum sollicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labris quae poterant ipsum sollicitare Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:66:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 66, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nova sollicitat, me tangit serior aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde (luxuria) frugalitatem professos sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44657.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invite</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis dotatam uxorem habet, eum hominem sollicitat sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Lorenz: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum sollicitant haec, Flacce, toreumata canem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:74:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 74, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, mira specie, feminarum sollicitaret oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deest forma quae sollicitet oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his (praediis venalibus) me multa sollicitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum delinimentis potest animos omnium sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni studio sollicitatum spe regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Graeciam Philippus cum venisset, sollicitatus paucarum civitatum direptione (i. e. spe diripiendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitati praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13" default="NO">2, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te plaga lucida caeli ... sollicitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno praemio sollicitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>bribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—So, <hi rend="ital">to attract the attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy the mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix umquam ita sollicitari partibus earum debeamus ut non et summae meminerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.14" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to incite one</hi> to do something. </sense><sense id="n44657.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To urge to wrong-doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inveigle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abet</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44657.16" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum sollicitare verbis, spe promissisque corrumpere, contra dominum armare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sollicitabit rursus agrarios?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitant homines imperitos Saxo et Cafo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: necare eandem voluit: quaesivit venenum; <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitavit quos potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo ... quos ex aere alieno laborare arbitrabatur, sollicitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: quos ingenti pecuniae spe sollicitaverant vestri (sc. <hi rend="ital">to murder Philip</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam ingentibus sollicitare datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio sperare sollicitari animos egentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 6</bibl>.—So esp. milit. t. t.,= temptare (freq. in the historians), <hi rend="ital">to strive to win over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi> to defection, attack, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sollicitandas civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanos Transrhenanos sollicitare dicebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 53</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 54: servitia urbana sollicitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissimos Hispanos in Italiam ad sollicitandos populares ... miserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinos populos haud ambigue sollicitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad continendas urbes, quas illinc Eumenes, hinc Romani sollicitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num sollicitati animi sociorum ab rege Perseo essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sollicitatos legationibus Persei, sed egregie in fide permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 23, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">45, 35, 8: interim qui Persas sollicitarent mittuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.17" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in servis ad hospitem necandum sollicitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum ad venenum dandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opifices et servitia ad Lentulum eripiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ultro ad transeundum hostes vocabant sollicitabantque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—After <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum milites ad proditionem, amicos ad perniciem meam pecunia sollicitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.18" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: civitates sollicitant <pb n="1722" /> <cb n="SOLL" /> ut in libertate permanere vellent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sollicitatum esse ut regnare vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missis ad accolas Histri, ut in Italiam irrumperent sollicitandos, Liv 39, 35: Darei litterae quibus Graeci milites sollicitabantur ut regem interficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.19" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">causa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comperi legatos Allobrogum tumultus Gallici excitandi causa a P. Lentulo esse sollicitatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44657.20" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">the prevailing constr. in Just.): amicum in adulterium uxoris sollicitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander in Italiam sollicitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>urgently invited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iones sollicitare in partes suas statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Peloponnenses in societatem armorum sollicitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:1" default="NO">32, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:5" default="NO">29, 4, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44657.21" n="6" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of abstract objects (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nuptae sollicitare fidem (= nuptam sollicitare ad fidem violandam),</quote> <trans><tr>to make attempts against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 4; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 463</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 721</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44657.22" n="B" level="2"> In gen., without implying an evil purpose, <hi rend="ital">to induce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">antequam est ad hoc opus (historiam scribendi) sollicitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>induced to undertake this work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Hecubae maritum posset ad Hectoreos sollicitare rogos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, sollicitatus ex urbe Roma (a Mithridate), praecepta pro se mitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitandi (parentes) ad hunc laborem erant,</quote> <trans><tr>it was necessary to give inducements to the parents to undertake this labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum juventutem ad imitationem sui sollicitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Helv. 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios Orientis regis ut idem postularent sollicitare temptavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum ... corpora nunc pretio, nunc ille hortantibus ardens sollicitat dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:485" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitat tunc ampla viros ad praemia cursu celeres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut per praecones susceptores sollicitarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander in Italiam a Tarentinis sollicitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia sollicitatus (= permotus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitatoque juvene ad colloquium,</quote> <trans><tr>allured him to the conference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc maxime sollicitatus ad amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes sollicitant ad se avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyaena ad sollicitandos canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut vacua possessione sollicitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remansit in caelibatu, neque sollicitari ulla condicione amplius potuit (i. e. ad uxorem ducendam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me, tamquam tirunculum, sollicitavit ad emendum (signum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex copia studiosorum circumspicias praeceptores quos sollicitare possimus (sc. ut huc veniant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">finemque expromere rerum sollicitat superos,</quote> <trans><tr>urgently implores to disclose the issue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rapiant mala facta bonos ... sollicitor nullos esse putare deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitat spatium decurrere amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1196</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritum sollicitat precibus, ne spem sibi ponat in arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 683</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
